title: Great RC  Truck for the Price
text: This is a great RC truck for the price. Assembly is fast and easy. There is a break in period, that requires running it on a smooth flat surface. Once the 1st battery is drained, you can then run it on rough ground and slopes. The performance is impressive.

title: Great value for $$$
text: For the price and car is great to begin with and use later on with improvement.

title: Very fast
text: Easy to use and is very fast for a battery powered car.

title: FUN!
text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas and he loves it.  He has never had an RC before and he learned it quickly.  Great toy!

title: Cannot beat iy for the price.
text: Seems to be built very strongly. Just received it today and batteries are charging. Cannot wait to get it outside. I bought this ass a Christmas present to myself for for my mental health. Still a kid at 70!  Now I can race with my grand children.

title: Great truck!
text: This truck is well worth the money!  it is very fast and very powerful for climbing.  Great product thus far.

title: You get what you pay for...
text:
I got this on sale for about $40, and it's probably worth every bit of that $40, but certainly not more. It's fast-ish for a beginners RC unit, but it's pretty quirky. By far the worst quirk is how reverse works. Instead of pushing the trigger away from your palm like in every other RC vehicle made, you do a weird double pull of the trigger. Then somehow this causes the vehicle to surge in reverse willy nilly until you crash into something. It's just bizarre how it gets stuck in reverse...

You can only charge on battery at a time, they use a super stiff connector that is almost impossible to connect, and the batteries *barely* fit into the truck itself.

It's fine as a toy for a grown up, if you know what you are getting is a cheap RC vehicle. But don't make the mistake of thinking this is in the same realm as a Traxxas or Kyosho or Tamiya RC vehicle - it's not even in the same realm.

title: Worth the cost!
text: This lil car is awesome! I really wouldn‚Äôt consider this a car for beginners. This car has a lot of ‚Äúget up‚Äù! It eats up the trail whether its grass, gravel, dirt or sand. The slightly over-sized tires maintain traction. I feel like a little kid again when playing with this thing. You get a lot of car for the price. It was money well spent!

title: You get a lot for the price
text:
I got this RC truck for my 12 year old son. He loves it. The truck has great performance and is a good step towards getting a true hobbyist truck. It has two speeds, decent suspension, and lots of spare parts available from Prime. The batteries are physically small and you can fit two onboard. Each battery lasts longer than I would have guessed. The truck comes with some spare parts that I assume are the ones that break the most.

These trucks are well built but they aren't hobbyist quality. If you crash these really hard you will break some pieces. My son bent a rear hub shaft and loses wheel nuts, but he has crashed it pretty hard. They are worth the price. I would buy one again without second thought.

title: Great
text: This is a fantastic product. It is very easy to use especially for beginners. The car is very durable and does very good in off-roading and some grass. I do agree with the directions when they tell you if this is your first time using it to keep it on low and in a nice wide open area. The set up before you use it is very user-friendly and the directions are very easy to follow and use.highly recommend this product for anybody that's looking for a fun toy to go off roading and a good time

title: Ran like a bat outta H3LL!!!
text:
Son loved it. And ran it like no tomorrow!!!
Lol
Ironically.... there was no tomorrow...he trashed it the same day....LOL

title: Good Product/ Poor customer service
text: Overall the product seems good but my son broke some parts and I contacted the seller to see where to buy replacement parts. He has told me for the last 4 months that he wants to help and will send new parts. I have contacted him over 10 times and still no parts. I just want to know where to purchase the parts.

title: Liked
text: Nice RC car

title: Best for beginners and children from 5yrs old all the way to adults (really!)
text:
The ability to turn the power down for those learning came in great use when introducing my 5 year old to RC cars. I wanted a car I could both he and I could get excited about. For him, the car will grow with him with the ability to turn the power up to full when he's ready. For me, it's fast enough to have fun with around a parking lot or in a field.

For beginners (including adults) the power and center of gravity make the car really hard to lose control which I did not appreciate until I drove it and watched my son learn how to drive. It's stable and a lot of fun to drive without a lot of frustration from needing to be a good driver. It probably goes 20mph on the high setting which for it's size is plenty thrilling.

The build quality is fine. Nothing has broken even though it's been dropped, crashed (into a wall by accident), flipped, cartwheeled - all of the things a beginner might accidentally do when learning. Batteries last a long time and I like how simplistic the body is.

I don't think this is actually a 1/10 scale. I think it's a bit smaller which again I did not appreciate until we had some time playing with it.

title: Nice package for the money
text:
I think for what you get this package is a good value. The chassis is built well and is not a "kids toy" for sure. What I mean by that is you're getting a hobby grade car, although it's not the best of the best.
So far it's speed, maneuverability, and capability on most terrain is amazing at this price point. I've had it plowing through water in the gutters and thick grass without issue. My 8 year old son was able to drive it well on the low speed setting after about 10 minutes of playing with it. The cheapest feeling part of the package is the controller but it works well and offers a nice amount of control and adjustment.
I think most people looking for some casual r/c fun will be impressed by this package and more specifically the car itself.

title: Awesome
text: I got this for my husbands birthday and he loves it. Simple to operate and fast.

title: Great car ... very fast

text: Love this car!  Its fast, its fun, its awesome!  Make sure you check the nuts on the tires to ensure they are tight!  I was jumping dirt hills and a tire flew off.  Lost the bolt but thank goodness you can order replacements!

title: Wheel broke off on first use. Will try to contact seller.
text: Wheel broke off on first use. Will try to contact seller.... It seams like a good little car. Pretty fast. But a rear wheel fell off on first use.

title: Great when it works
text:
Update 10/5: Received amazon replacement, EXACT same thing happened. Only this time to two different wheels, not just one. Luckily I was able to find the locknuts this time. I tightened them, and we were driving it indoors on carpet on low speed and literally 3mph. The wheels fell off 3-4 different times. Even after I tightened them as much as I could, within reason of course! I sent it back and purchased an Arrma granite 4x4 brushed motor. I paid a tad more, but think it'll be worth it. Thank God for Amazons return policy. As Laegendary was initially unwilling to send me $0.30 locknuts after I told them Amazon sent me a replacement vehicle.... Really? Then they kept insisted I put crazy glue on the locknuts... I didn't buy a model car, I purchased an RC car.

This truck is a little monster, it wheelies, peels out, kicks back anything under it, flies on short grass and handles long grass as well also. However!! During my first use, the rear wheel popped off while driving it. Keep in mind, this thing only saw flat roads and grass, I never took it "off-roading" or "bashing." I was VERY disappointed in that. I spent almost double on this than I did on any of my other trucks for my kids and it was the one that broke the fastest, actually the ONLY one that broke. I was in contact with the seller and they are going to send me a new locknut, but I'm not sure I trust the particular car I have. So, I have a useless $150 truck in my kids room, a very heavy and fat paperweight for now. That really bothers me.... According to all of the reviews on it, I might have just gotten a lemon. I am returning it for a replacement through Amazon. If it happens again, I will steer clear of this brand. This was a a present for my son, I was embarrassed when his was the only one that broke.

title: Buyer Beware
text: This truck seemed great at first. Then 4 wheel drive stopped working less than a week after having it. Not worth paying over $100 for it. Would not recommend!

title: Buyer Beware
text: This truck seemed great at first. Then 4 wheel drive stopped working less than a week after having it. Not worth paying over $100 for it. Would not recommend!

title: So much better than expected
text:
We've had a bunch of less expensive (cheap) RC cars, trucks, vehicles in the past. This was about 2x the price of the higher end of the el-cheapos we've bought for our son in the past. This has delivered 10x (no exaggeration at all) the fun and quality of those.

It's super fast. It has survived crashes, rolls, jumps, and jams. It sends rooster tails of wood chips and dirt. It is a blast. My 88 yr old father, who is not easily impressed, went out of his way to let me know he wanted to play with it after he saw my son driving it.

It is NOT really suitable as a first RC car for two reasons. First it is just so fast and agile. Second, if you go straight to this you'll miss out on experiencing the incredible increase in performance over what is typically your first RC car.

All parts are replaceable. If you are in the market to spend about this much for an RC vehicle, this one is a no-brainer.

title: Outstanding speed, ready to run as soon as you put in batteries.
text: Fantastic racer, love the speed. ended up switching to ko speed for G-kid to use. Once they have the experience I'll bump it back up!! Most impressive is receiving fully charged batteries. A couple of design hints I like to see. Battery compartment accessible without having to take the top off. Second, add the length of trigger travel to enable finer control of speed. Third, allow for a tighter/wider turn radius.

title: Easy to set up and fast fun!
text: This truck is worth the price.  Wish we had bought one of these years ago instead of the 5 other low-quality RC cars we've tried.

title: Great remote control truck that is durable and can operate on difficult terrains.
text: This remote control truck far exceeded my expectations. I made the mistake of buying a cheaper model first and hopefully you won‚Äôt make the same mistake. The truck is durable and easily handles the crashes my young son makes. The two speed setting is a great feature. Low speed for learning and high speed for the more advanced. The four wheel drive is even better as this unit can handle rough terrain with ease.

title: Great product!
text: Make sure you do half speed when you first do this. 11 and 9 year old boys that love this car!

title: Very sturdy
text: Bought this for my 9year old grandson.  He loves it.  Also long battery life.

title: Hobby fun
text: Bought this as a gift for my husband. He‚Äôs into hobby cars and he loves this! Very durable. Love that it goes fast, can go through water, works great in the dirt or on the street! Lots of power! Would recommend!

title: They say "sharing is caring" üòí
text: Fun truck!  I might have to buy more because the kids are fighting for their turn.  I'm 40 years old and want my turn too!

title: Great RC truck for ages 8+
text:
Bought for my 8yo boy. First, just want to say he loves it. Definitely going to get some extra battery packs so he can use it longer although the original battery seems to charge in ~3h. My 6yo who is used to driving Walmart special RC‚Äôs can drive it but not well and hits things a lot in an open years/driveway even on low. Fast speed is FAST!! It‚Äôs shockingly fast. Makes ya go ‚Äúhuh‚Äù no way as you run out of sight!

Pros:
-runs great in any terrain even high grass
-easy to start and go
-easy to steer and very responsive
-speed lever on the remote is variable throttle. Wasn‚Äôt sure when buying, but is definitely is which is great. Pull trigger half way and get half throttle. (6yo doesn‚Äôt grasp that but 8 yo can).
-fast but low speed isn‚Äôt ‚Äútoo fast‚Äù. 90% of the time my 8yo drives in L speed which saves battery juice but occasionally kick up to H and let it rip! Easily pops wheelies on H every time you hit the gas!
-seems very well made. Kids are rough on RC and I have no regret to buy for older kid use
-love the big size (they had similar Wallymart size)

CONS:
-not sure pro/con‚Ä¶battery lasts about 45 mins when using low speed and 2 batteries together. Wish it were more, could be less I guess but that on par with the post so I won‚Äôt take stars off.
-the 2-battery connector provided is nearly impossible to get tucked in with the batteries and get the cover on. It can be done but takes way too much playing , wiggling, take out and repositioning again.
-Flimsy body and pins holding it on. Anticipate that will be the point of toy failure for daily kid use
-gets super hot on the entire bottom when using.
-owner‚Äôs manual isn‚Äôt too helpful. First time batteries were low it blinked the cars LED blue rapidly. Wasn‚Äôt sure if that was a malfunction, overheat (since first time and it was super hot) or what. Read in the Amazon Q/A section that means ‚Äúlow battery‚Äù AKa normal operation. The manual didn‚Äôt even mention it.
-sort of ugly paint job. More color/body options would be nice.

Price was a tad more than some others, but I found a nice review online comparing/contrasting various name brands and of those in the review Legendary was by far the best. Seeing that I figured if $20 extra gets a better product it will be worth it. We‚Äôll see. I found probably 15+ different options within the price range $100-150. I‚Äôll post an update if we have a longevity issue.

Thanks Legendary for a great product so far!

title: Well Built RC Truck
text: My First RC Truck, it seems to be a very solid built RC Truck. Broke the motor in on a road surface at half speed which was plenty fast. At half speed I got at lease 30+ maybe closer to 45 min of run time. I am very please with the truck so far. I liked the fact the the manual has a replacement parts section that looks like you could replace about any part you needed. I did notice the charger that came with the truck is a USB type charger set up. But in the manual that comes with the Truck it shows a different style of charger. I believe it is just an older type of charger. The USB charger works fine. I feel so far for the money I spent it was well worth it.

title: Great car!
text: This car is so much fun. I love the cable that allows two batteries to connect to each other for 30 minutes of fun. The car is made very well.

title: awesome!
text: my grandkids love it!i bought two ,so they can have fun together!

title: Amazing Value
text: I was into Adult RC's over 10 years but got out because of the over priced moderate quality. This Legend completely changes the game. Quality like this would have cost over $400 about 10 yrs ago.

title: Fast and fun over obstacles!
text: Pretty much as you'd expect for a highly rated RC vehicle. It is really quick to accelerate, so much so you pretty much have to use it outside. The tires do a great job getting over obstacles and the speed means this thing jumps into the air pretty well for its size. Battery life is decent, but having 2 batteries is a huge plus. They are standard USB chargers, so that makes it hand for recharging. Also get a small storage bag for extra parts. All in all, would definitely buy again. My 10 YO loves it.

title: My kid loves it
text: I gave this car to my son for his birthday. He loves how big and fast it is. With both batteries installed he gets more than 40 minutes run time. It is a tight fit to get both batteries in but it works. If you buy aftermarket batteries make sure the leads are long enough or you won't be able to get both batteries in. We bought the Hosim aftermarket batteries and the leads are two short to install both batteries. The LED light are very bright and helpful when the car is far away and you can't tell which way it is going. It seems pretty tough and durable because he is still getting use to it and he has crashed it pretty good in several occasions.

title: start out SLOW.....This car is FAST !!!!!
text: Very NICE car.

title: Great

title: Great quality and very fast. Will be appreciated by experienced modelers.
text: Very, very fast. This is not good for beginners. The throttle control is smooth and responsive. Great with jumps and rough surfaces. It's very well-built and feels solid. I like the cover, but I would like more options. I think the battery protective case for charging is a good bonus.

title: Buy it...you know you want too. 5 STARS!
text: This is a Christmas present for my boys and I just tested it out to see how it works....WOW I am impressed this monster truck has so much speed no problem doing wheelies it will flip over if you throttle it too fast...this is a present so I cant give an outdoor review at this time but I can tell you the way this RC car is built very well...under carriage has alot of protection from wear in tear also it has a very good turning radius considering the big tires...I give this product 6 stars...my boys are gonna go bananas when they get them....we have had RC cars before they all fail in comparison to this one!

title: Good quality with one issue
text: This is very well made and worth the money. Responsive and can go over rugged terrain with ease. Just beware, make sure your remote control has fresh batteries. If your remote batteries die while using long distance, the signal will disconnect and the car will get away from you...has a mind of its own then. The car will just keep going. Not good.

title: This car is awesome.
text: [[VIDEOID:5bd2976f73c4b5a0466b41db02ff9c4e]] So fast and so durable.  We have been driving them for a week and they are great.  The lights are so cool at night.  We ordered 2 other brands of RC car and returned both of them to get another one of these because they were so fun.  We have been driving them for about a week so far and they are working great.  I would recommend low speed until you get in the wide open space then crank it to high speed and watch it rip through.

title: Great RC car all around!!!
text: I took this camping and used it every day. It has a ton of torque and its fast too. It is very refined for a car in this price range.  It basically travels over any terrain, hills, rocks, dirt, brush, and dense forest. I love it , for this price point it cant be beat. it even comes with a parts list and 2 batteries which do last 30 minutes each as advertised. My son is 5 and he has experience. On slow mode which is not very slow, he handled the car pretty well considering the precise steering control and low center of gravity.

Wish I knew prior to investing into Laegendary R/C cars. When I called to speak to customer service they didn‚Äôt seem to care. Disappointed in buying a few cars already from them, should have just spent the money on Traxx

title: Take off the protective film on the plastic body before use.
text: Wish the battery life was longer. Had to return it because I felt paying for spare parts would be unnecessarily expensive. Motor overheats kinda quick if u drive it on high for a while. Felt flimsy for some reason. Should have just made the battery compartment big enough for the dual battery connector as well as two batteries. Felt like remote was losing connection out of nowhere when going from forward to reverse and vice versa. I feel one brushless motor is better than 2 brushed 390 motors. Wheels and tires seemed a little too big for the body.

title: really good starter car, my 4 yo enjoys it with me

text: I know that high-end RC cars can go for several hundred dollars.  This is an absolutely amazing car for the price.  It was a b-day gift for my 21-year son, and he's been having a blast with it.

title: Good to Marginal Value
text: Chassis and suspension A-arms made of soft plastic.  Because of this, shock mounts are very flexible and screws do not anchor solidly.  Do not over tighten or they will strip.  Suspension action is poor due to flex related binding.  Had a tie rod screw pull out, front shock top mount loosen up, rear bumper screw loosen up and the right front tire fall off a all by the third day.  It did come with extra wheel nuts and body pins so the tire falling off was not a show stopper.  You have to regularly check the screws or it will fall apart over time.  It‚Äôs fast and fun for my 7yo son, but it is not a Losi quality vehicle.  Fun for the price.  Worth the money as my son loves playing with it.

title: Runs just as good as the high end RCs

title: bad quality
text: At the beginning it worked great but after a few days it started to break apart. My kid didn't even use it too much. Customer service told me that the broken parts weren't part of the warranty so i had to order the parts separately. After spending hours fixing it, my kid could use the car but a few days after, it broke again. Customer service told me that that part is not covered by the warranty again so i gave up with the car. My thought is;, it is not a cheap car, you can get a remote control toy for $20 at Walmart, i expected it to last more and/or to have a better warranty. I won't recommend it.

title: Great Entry Level RC For the Price
text: Just got into the hobbie, and couldn't see spending $400+ on  a Traxxas or Arma (but I did anyways) so I bought this. I was skeptical, but pleasantly surprised after bashing the absolute s*** out of it! This thing is tough, fast, and durable. It is great for beginners as it is easily controlled at any skill level. I took this out with buddies who have the 6s and 4s Traxxas and Arma trucks, but I got more play time and crashed and bashed this thing way more than they could because the design of this truck is made with bashing in mind. Cannot be more satisfied with this entry level truck. Great for all ages!

title: Great for beginners

The lights are a nice touch for night driving. And the dual batteries give it a great run time.. The RC will outlast the boys attention.

My main complaint is you have to take to body off everytime you put the battery in and there isn't enough room to tuck the wires to put the battery cover on, so it's kinda crammed in there. title: Very Fast
text: All I can say, is, "Thank you".  We have a large family, and we have invested in many remote control cars in varying classes and price levels.  We bought this for a son who saw his older brothers experience disappointment after disappointment with many problems, easy breakage, slow moving, complicated operation, battery's dying way too easily, and then it's taking 10 batteries out of each unit, charging them, putting them all back, and so on and so on and so on, with former purchases and other radio control cars.  Needless to say, he actually asked me NOT to get him a remote control car,(even though he'd love on that works and lasts) because, of all of the broken and lame cars we have seen before.  This car, however, changed him.  He's 13, and usually I have to coax him out of bed..  This morning, he was up and ready to play with this car!  He has thanked me over and over, and is so delighted about everything on this racing legend.  It is easy to operate, excepting perhaps the controller that he says, has a bit of play, but, other then that, everything looks great, and I appreciate how happy he is.  It literally zooms(super fast, in my sons own words), smoothly everywhere, battery removal is way easy, charging batteries is simple, Thank you.

title: Sometimes it freaks out and goes it's own way
text: First, the car is fun, long battery, great range and able to handle grass and light snow like a champ.  The one problem we have had with it is, if you have the vehicle at a dead stop, then pull the throttle (trigger) all the way back to accelerate as fast as possible, sometimes the vehicle goes into reverse instead of forward.  When this happens it just keeps going no matter what you do with the throttle and the only way to stop the vehicle is to turn off the remote.  This is not a one-time incident with just my kids etc.  This happens almost anytime someone tries to give the throttle 100% from a dead stop.  This doesn't happen if you accelerate more slowly.

title: Fun RC, but I wish I knew then what I know now
text:
I wanted to wait to give an honest review on this product. Our kids got into RCs this past summer (2020) and I didn't know squat about them. Did some research for a few days and my son wanted to buy his own RC. He had the money to buy a Traxxas or Arrma, but we didn't want him to spend that much of his own money. He bought the Laegendary Monster Truck. He had it 2 weeks and the rear diff cup broke. I ordered the upgraded diff and drive shaft. Thankfully found a video that showed how to replace that and boy what a pain that was. Lots of screws. LOTS. To get to the rear diff and even more to replace the drive shaft. Those weren't too expensive, but knowing what I know now looking at the price of parts for the truck. They are very expensive if you have start replacing screws or drive shafts and other various parts. This is a hobby grade RC. There is maintenance involved and things are going to break eventually. The truck's front diff is currently broken. By the way the differential cups break on these very easy. It's a common thing with the plastic differentials that come in these trucks. I guess that is why they sell the upgraded metal ones. I have the diff here. I just dread taking the entire truck apart to fix it.

Two weeks later my daughter bought a Traxxas Slash 2WD. Yes it was a bit more ($220), but I couldn't believe the simplicity of the truck. Everything was so easy to get to and work on. Parts are abundant and cheap. I've only had to replace a hear axle hub. $4 for a pair from RPM (great aftermarket parts for RCs) that is all.

This January 2021 my son, for his birthday, got the Arrma Big Rock Crew Cab to replace the Laegendary Monster Truck (which is mine now). This is another brand that is simple to work on. For comparison it takes 4 screws to access the front diff and 4 screws to access the rear diff. Very simple design.

I'm not trying to knock on Laegendary. I had lots of questions after we got the truck and they would always answer within a day through email. There are a lot of people that enjoy this truck. It is a fun truck to play with. It goes through just about any terrain with ease and is pretty fast for a brushed RC Truck. I'm part of a Facebook Group for Laegendary and will get this one up and running at some point.

I just want people to know there are reasons Arrma, Traxxas, Redcat, Axial, etc. cost more and not just paying for a name. You have part availability, maintenance, aftermarket parts, hop ups, and most of all (for me) easy access to everything for maintenance.

text:

Make sure you tighten the front wheels when you get it. I have two of these and for some reason they come with loose front wheels. Not a big deal you'll just end up with two wheel drive and eventually a wheel will fall off. One downfall is any replacement parts have to come from the company. All and all it's a great car, comes with two batteries and the control is easy to use and comfortable.

title: This thing is a blast!
text:
[[VIDEOID:7247439fdc1cbb1a7c50c67eca9aafa9]] I bought this car because I needed an RC car to take video and pictures of the underside of bigger vehicles. For the price, I figured this would be good enough to do what I needed, and boy was I pleasantly surprised. I mounted a three GoPro mounts on the body and then drove the car with the cameras running and got exactly what I was trying to achieve.

Then I took the cameras off and decided to play around with the car for fun and what a blast! This car is so much fun to drive, really fast, and very sturdily built for its price.

For a car this price, the remote control is not terrible, but I am used to drones and 1/4 scale RC planes and helicopters and would far rather have sticks than the wheel and trigger.

This car is wicked fast. If you have never driven an RC car before, just know that you have a bit of a learning curve with this one and you should definitely follow the advice to take it out on a big piece of open ground to learn how to drive it.

All round, really cool car and a load of fun.

I've only hit a few small jumps and the suspension cushions the landing well. It's wider than it is long, so drifting is a little tricky but definitely possible. It has a low/high speed switch, so it's good for beginners and intermediate alike. Seasoned drivers may be a little underwhelmed, but for average Joes like myself, this is a great deal and tons of fun. Oh, it comes with two batteries, btw. When my kids get better driving their smaller/cheaper cars I'm getting this one for them too!

title: Best Bang for your Buck
text:
Ready to go right out of the box, well made, great customer service and support, replacement parts readily available, and a ton of fun. My 7 year-old son wanted an RC truck bad, so I had him save his money while I did my research and this truck was the winner by far - you just can't go wrong with this truck. Laegendary RC's are not a "toy" you'd find at Walmart, but aren't insanely priced enthusiast level models either. It's a real RC truck with real suspension, real capability, and they take a beating with replacement parts available if you do crash them hard or wear components out. I'll list my small complaints, though none are worth a star deduction.

PROS:
+All-in-one kit, plug 'n play
+Solid construction
+Good customer service/support
+Replacement parts and components available (see manual)
+Comes with some replacement parts (wheel nuts, body pins, etc)
+30MPH high speed
+Good controller/transmitter

CONS:
-Two charging cables, but only one charger (most phone USB chargers work though)
-Both batteries in the truck is a tricky squeeze, but doable (increases run-time, but you can also just swap out batteries rather than run both)
-LiPo batteries require special care and storage, but the charger doesn't have a volt meter or "storage charge" ability nor are there instructions on storage. Digging into the manuals, it appears the truck shuts down when the batteries hit 3.8 volts, well above the 3 volt minimum to keep LiPo's healthy when stored. So you should probably run the truck until dead, then store the drained batteries in their pouch until next use because storing fully charged or under charged (3V) LiPo batteries can degrade or even damage the cells. This is a bit of a hassle as having batteries ready to go and always charged is ideal, but it's only a 60-90 minute charge time.

Overall, I'm extremely happy with this purchase, and my son is thrilled. Would definitely buy again... or buy another Laegendary model for myself, lol. If you want more speed (40MPH vs 30) and longevity, Laegendary makes an upgraded brushless motor version of this truck called Thunder. If you want a bigger 1:8 scale truck, opt for their Nitro or Rango models.

title: Poor quality, returned after 4th use
text: Battery swelled up after 4th charge, 2) run time is much less than 30+ minutes as advertised 3) faulty connection runs the car rogue upon battery swap.

title: Well worth the money for several reasons.
text:
I bought this for my 8 year old son and he absolutely loves it. The low speed mode is a big help with training and it still moves very well. After 2 days of driving, he whips it around over the driveway, grass and gravel. One of the great features, I feel, is the sealed compartment. I owned probably a dozen RC vehicles and my biggest gripe was cleaning them out. I wiped his off a little and it looks great again. The double battery definitely helps in the runtime area. He gets a good 40+ mins of run time. The only downside I see is the long charge periods, but that can easily be overcome with extra batteries and also helps them live longer. So maybe it is not necessarily a bad thing.

Overall, I like the quality of the vehicle. The shocks are oil filled and there are ball bearings throughout. Of course, it is not as easily upgradable as the Traxxas or other brands models, but if you are looking for something simple, rugged and fun for your young kids to introduce them to the hobby, it is a great entry point. I can't wait to see his face when I put it on high speed mode. Try not to get caught up in the hype of top speed numbers from any of the RC vehicles. The enjoyment your child has driving it will be the greatest reward.

title: Cheap upfront cost for good perfomance, but HIGH maintenance cost
text:
The car is a blast to drive, my boy loves it. However, I just got done spending nearly $100 on parts after just 5-6 uses, and I've also had it apart twice to fix the steering servo (horn somehow slipped on the splined shaft, I suspect its stripped--new servo motor needed.)

One of the front axles fell out, and I see its because one of the pins sheared off of it at the CV. The rear differential is obviously in the process of stripping out based on the grinding sound I am hearing. They do include a new all metal rear differential in the box, but they also say you should replace the main shaft with an upgraded one at the same time you upgrade the differential or with the differential or else you will just strip out.

Fortunately its a somewhat fun activity to work on these things together, but kind of annoying to have to spend >70% of the cars purchase price for new parts in less than a week.

It is not for indoors!  It's too fast and you will hit everything inside.  If you want your grandchildren to visit often and not want to leave, buy it!  I did. I'm 66.  My 8 year old wants his own so he can be the talk of the neighborhood.  That's how impressive it is.  With this RC car, you get 2 batteries.

title: Not as tough as suggested.
text:
So i decided to buy my son an RC truck. I wanted a tough off roader who can take a beating and keep on ticking. This however was not the experience we got. Ive had RC cars and tanks since the early 80s , Tamiya, associated, Kyosho. They were fast, this one not so. im not sure if you can use 3s or 4s batts if so then ill be wrong. 390 cans are small motors compared to 540, but 2 sounded like a great mix.
So i did an inspection of the truck and it is well sealed, i even tightened up the important nuts, after passing my checklist and making sure the batteries are good , me and the boys set off for our little adventure at the park. We decided to do rings around the baseball field, and my sons drove it on the slow speed setting , this to them was a bit fast but overall he did a good job. Then after 10 min, i switched it on to the fast setting. Within a lap the truck sank to its front and dragged itself before stopping , the left wheel had flown off and the nut vanished. so i checked to see what was needed to make this a RC car again. So what was a perturbing to me was the part attaching itself to the rims were plastic that made a cross sign so the rims can fit tight and square on it. Now that should be metal and not plastic. I do see that to be a problem area for this type of RC truck. MY entire driving experience was 12 min. before a catastrophic failure occured. I dont see myself keeping it .

title: superfun!!
text: I actually got this for my 46 year old son's birthday - but I have played with it also.  We have 5 acres and I built a trackk with obstacles, a rock hill, jump, banked curve, etc.  He was shocked by the car and equally shocked by the track.  What fun we've had.  After the track we ran it in our field and up and down a rocy ravine - more fun.  Our little donkey wasn't a huge fan as he didn't know what to make of this thing.  He ran from across the field up to me and nuzzled his head against me.  This may be the new way to round up animals and get them back to the corral at night.  More track is planned and offroad racing.  Great fun - highly recommend.  Vern Miller

title: Can't use, doesn't pair with remote
text: [[VIDEOID:1bd237668d7799ef2c82570f8cbb974f]] We purchased this as a gift for my son, but after opening it and charging the batteries, it doesn't pair with the remote. The LED on the RC truck just flashes. We reached out to customer service and they had us open the remote to check that everything inside was plugged in. It was. They asked us to send a video of the problem. After sending that, they sent information, which we already had in the manual, about keeping it away from large metal objects. They finally agreed to send a replacement remote so that's on its way. However, from other videos we've watched, the headlight kit that came with the truck should turn on when you turn on the battery, but that isn't happening. When I told that to customer support, they sent back a response to explain how the LED lights flash when pairing, so not what I was explaining. Then after I replied, they sent a video about how to install LED lights on an RC vehicle, but it was a generic video by some RC hobbyists, not specific to the truck that came with a light kit without needing tools and such. Basically, my customer support experience has not been very helpful. If the remote arrives and is able to pair, then I will update my review.

title: Fun......... when it worked.
text: [[VIDEOID:4c3fedd777d1fa7db702ebcae45e733]] I have had problems from the beginning. The controller would not bind with the car on occasions. It didn't always happen, but it happened enough and it always took hours of turning them both off and on for it to finally get it work again. Sometimes I would give up and wait a day or two. I contacted Laegendary by email and they were awesome and very responsive. They had me send a video in of my issue. They told be the issue is the ESC LG-ZJ07 which is the receiver on the RC car. They sent me a new one with instructions on how to install it. I had to take the car apart and solder the receiver to the motors. It was a pain to do, but it worked for a little while, but now I have the same problem except this time it does bind all. I can't use the car at all. I contacted Laegendary again and sent them a video and they said it's the controller or ESC LG-ZJ07 and to buy another one. That sucks. I feel like I should have been able to get the whole thing replaced from the beginning because I had the issue from day one and shouldn't have to repair it myself. I should have spent a little more money and had gotten a better brand hobby car. This RC car is a lot of fun, but but it has only been a pain in the a$$ for me.

title: Great RC truck!
text:
Wanted to wait to write a review until we had used it a bit.

First, it's a great RC Truck. As described and performs as described. Very pleased with that.

Customer service: This deserves 10 stars. The best I've encountered on Amazon aside from Amazon itself. They responded within hours, not days, and even contacted me to make sure I received it. Due to some reading as delivered, but never delivered. Delivery not what it used to be. Arm yourself with a front porch camera.

Overall: Really great. Everything as described. Very pleased.

Battery: Two come with it and the truck can hold one or two. We use two for over 40 minutes of run time. Charge time is about 90 minutes.

Durability: This is the cause for 4 stars. Now, no doubt it's held up very well being used by my 14 year old son. But it's important to know you'll be replacing parts. They're all available on Amazon and the owners manual has all of there part numbers.
I've replaced and/or will be replacing:
Front Bumper Block
Front Lower Arm
Tires
Arm Connector Set
And I ordered 100 replacement pins. They come out every outing. I'll be ordering an additional cover at some point also. It takes a beating.
The front end steering is getting off. Doesn't turn right great. I'll be taking apart to have a look.
I ordered an RC car repair tool kit as well.

All in all though, really great. I'd order another from Laegndary. But they have limited options. Will order another Hosim though. Don't need to pay for a Traxxas. Way over priced they are.

title: Best product / customer service experience I‚Äôve had in a long time
text:
This is one of my favorite products and product experiences I‚Äôve had in a long time.

The quality of the product is great. Easy to setup and get driving. Feels premium. Drives exceptionally well. Fast and responsive. Looks awesome. And the cost made it a great value.

We had a minor issue when we originally started driving the car and reached out to the customer support team for help. They responded back within 24 hours and fixed the issue quickly. Communication and overall customer experience was awesome.

Bought this as a Christmas present for my son. He loves it and I secretly (not so secretly now) love it as well. Highly recommended product.

title: Wheel broke off on first use

title: Dont use on beach sand
text: This Rc is awesome for the price I bought a few extra batteries for longer play time. This thing rips awesome that its 4wd but I think it would be better if the front and rear had limited slip to crawl better under heavy climbing it does the one wheel wonder in the front and rear when it comes off center. This Rc has terrific steering response and runs straight. Great for beginners in low gear and awesome fun for pros. Great for the price I highly recommend it. Only downfall is cant run it on sand as it gets everywhere inside the Rc I had to take it apart and clean it took me 3 hours to get all the sand out and taking it completely apart. Would be awesome if they put like a mesh screen on the intakes to reduce sand intake.

title: Perfect gift for a 9yr old or 39yr old
text: Whole family is loving the car.  I wanted something that was good for beginners, but powerful enough to cut through grass and gravel.  This truck is fast on the roads, but it just becomes a blast when you can take it to a field or park or woods and just race around the dirt rocks and leaves.  I had the Hosim version of this, but a car ran that one over 3 days after Christmas.  When I went to replace it, found this Laegendary one on a Deal of the Day.  Glad I stepped up to this one, because I can definitely tell some difference with the shocks, but I love the dual battery option and the lights have added a whole other layer of fun.  I can't speak to how long it's going to last, but we've already put at least 8 driving hours on this, and it's still running perfectly.  Even if this only lasted 6 months, it would still be worth it for the entertainment.  Buy Extra batteries and chargers for sure.

title: I spent hour researching RC Cars before purchasing this one.
text:
It ended up coming down to this vehicle and one other. The deciding factor was '2 selectable speeds' which allows very controlled speed inside the house. Also it came with a good charger, two batteries, extra body pins, and a lot of run time per battery. The vehicle had many good reviews and well written comments. I wasn't disappointed with what I received. I haven't had the chance to use it outside yet, but inside I have no problem driving it quite slowly (To play with my cat) My Dog appears quite leery of it. A couple times I accelerated hard just to see what it would do,and it's really fast. In 'H' or high speed mode, it is way to fast to use in the house. There is a bit of hesitation when switching to reverse, I have to hit the trigger twice to get it to go into reverse if it's already going forward. It is a well constructed, high quality feeling frame.
I do recommend this vehicle, if the price range falls within your budget.

title: Durable, quality product - very happy with the purchase
text: This was my first buy or a rc and I'm very happy that I bought this legendary product. Whether it's a beginner or advanced, I can't say that, but this is definitely a good product. We were playing in the backyard, I had a trashcan outside, my son drove into it and it made a good dent on the trashcan and nothing on the car. Controls are good, battery quality is good as well. I should have brought two of these instead of buying one Hosim car. They gave you list of parts on the manual and parts seems well available. It covers the motor and battery, so standing water was not a problem.

title: Read, research, then buy more batteries
text: After many YouTube videos I was undecided about either Nitro or battery powered RC cars. This one seemed like the best bet so I went and got it and extra battery‚Äôs. Read the instructions. Many things are needed to know. Charge your batteries, don‚Äôt stay at top speed, and don‚Äôt let the batteries charge too long. We went through 3 battery packs in about 2 hours. Not great but not bad either. Love it so far.

title: Great truck for the money!
text:
Update: The drive gear is made of plastic so expect to replace it after a month or so. The seller needs to put a metal gear in it to avoid this problem, but I'm assuming they will not to make a few extra bucks off of it. I'm going to have to make my own gear to avoid buying a new gear every month. If you drive it in low speed in the grass it'll last you a while, but that's pretty boring.

This truck is amazing for the price. It has 2 speeds(high/low), and high is max speed, low is for beginners and inside driving. It does move quick on high speed, but it doesn't do the 30mph as claimed which isn't bad. It's an entry level truck for those looking to get into serious r/c vehicles eventually. I enjoy it and it's not scared of jumps, hills, rocks, sand or even water. I wouldn't suggest submerging it, but it can be driving quickly through shallow puddles and snow.

üëç Takes a beating, so far still working after lots of hard hits on solid objects
üëç Durable frame and undercarriage that is plated in front and back
üëç Quick and nimble
üëç Dual battery setup is a time saver
üëç Has decent lights for a quick evening run

üëé Battery bay is tight for the setup, even tho I made it fit on the duel connect. There is not a strap I've seen like the listing image
üëé Wheels come loose too often
üëé The Axle portion nearest to the wheel lock nut seems to bend from impact. Can bend it back but it is wobbly.
üëé Price seems a bit high in comparison with other cars of similar caliber and quality
üëé Dual battery connector was defective and had to get a replacement. It was free from return w/amazon, but 1st one was broke on arrival nonetheless

title: Great Product, Great Customer Service
text:
Before our RC truck arrived, we emailed the company to request a printable copy of the pdf manual. They responded in less than 24 hours with exactly what we wanted. EXCELLENT CUSTOMER SERVICE

The truck comes mostly assembled (which is good for novices like us). After charging the batteries and installing the lights, this truck was ready to rock! START ON THE LOW SETTING as this truck FLIES! It even popped wheelies! The transmitter/controller is super responsive. After running deep into a shrubbery, I was able to rock the truck forward and back a few times and then it backed right out.

This is super fun to drive. It does not feel like a toy. Check out Laegendary.com for replacement parts (if you need them - this truck is built to last). We ran into a few things (curb, tree stump, car tire) and it kept right on going with no damage to the truck.

This truck is AWESOME! We will be purchasing a second one so we can race.

title: It works, but...
text:
I bought this RC truck as an exercise aide for my dog, Kona. She loves to chase after it and run along with it so she gets as much exercise as the limited battery life allows. So as far as meeting my expectations it does a good job.

However battery life is disappointing. I'd estimate that with two fully charged batteries we get, at best, 20 minutes of play time. Now it is wintertime and the temperatures outside are cool so we can expect reduced battery performance relative to summertime temperatures. But I haven't had the truck during a summer yet so I have no real basis for comparison. As a result, battery charge lifetime does not meet my expectations.

We run the truck on both asphalt pavement and park grass. It does pick up a lot of grass clippings from the lawn and they get wrapped around the axles and into the wheels so clean-up takes a while. I'm also starting to hear a "grinding" sound that suggests that dirt or something else has worked its way into the mechanical part of the car. I'll have to open it up to see what I find.

Overall we are enjoying using the truck. But more importantly Kona is, too!

title: Hands Down The Best Value Out There!
text:
I will say this, I was blown away with how good this truck is.

1. Build is super high quality for sure. I have been running this thing ragged through the beach dunes, mountain terrain and even some puddle action!

2. Set up could not be easier. Completely self explanatory and easy to get up and running. One piece that I didn‚Äôt read but might have missed is when the battery is fully charged the green light goes from flashing to solid green.

3. Controls are very precise and love the ability to customize everything from trigger set, steering and even turning radius.

BUY THIS TRUCK! You will be so happy you did. I think reviews are so important and often I am too busy to write them. In this case I had to make time for this fantastic truck. Have sent the link to all my folks to pick one up. Soooooo worth the money!!!

title: Some parts not available.
text: This is an awesome R/C car.  It's very fast and good at drifting (sliding on turns).  It's fairly rugged, but some parts are easily broken. Needed new LED lights under warranty and they are not available.  It's easy to offer warranty when parts aren't available...you're off the hook!

title: Overall happy but nuanced
text: Wanted a sub-hobby grade RC to get the daughter into it and this fit the bill. Surprisingly it has metal driveshafts and hubs! A tire came off but a simple hub nut and loctite fixed that issue. Its speed and power are plenty for a beginner and it‚Äôs light enough to take some tumbles without it breaking. We are having an issue with the controller however, something inside the steering wheel is clicking and we lose steering to one side. I smacked the controller and it came back and so far has not done it again. I DO NOT like that it is very difficult to get both batteries installed at once, it‚Äôs a puzzle. It can be done but it‚Äôs super tight, they need to change the design of the battery case. The batteries last longer than expected but they take a while to charge via usb. Overall we are happy with it.

title: Fun, fast and pretty durable.
text: Got this for my 3 y/o and it wound up being more of a gift for me, lol.  I also have a much more expensive, big-name RC "basher" and this thing is actually more fun in some ways: the slower speed is more enjoyable when tooling around in thy front yard and its fun to powerslide around the driveway without fear that it'll break something or hurt my kid.  The battery life is also decent.  Bear in mind that you WILL break some parts!  I've replaced the axle shafts several times,  which seems to be the weakest link.  I also had to replace a motor because the gear stripped.  All easy fixes though,  and for me that's half the fun of RC.

title: [UPDATED] Steering servo broke after less than ten runs
text:
[UPDATE]. After spending a lot of time and effort, I replaced the steering servo. We took it out for a run and after about five minutes of using it, the left back wheel fell off. I am not making this up.

[ORIGINAL REVIEW] My son bought this with his own money and now it doesn't work after less than ten runs. The steering servo busted and all they did was give me a link to a really low quality video on how to replace the servo. Trouble is, our model is slightly different than the one in the video and after an hour I still can't get access to the servo. I'm disappointed and my kid is despondent.

title: Don't ever buy this product!
text: I'm so disappointed with the quality of this product I'm writing a product review for the very first time!  Maximum battery life across each of the two batteries we have is no more than 15 minutes, and we've had 2 of the 4 wheels fall completley off?!  If the batteries lasted longer this would be a great product, but they don't, so I wish I was eligible for a refund because this was effectively one big fat waste of money.  Stay away!

title: Broke two of them less than 30 minutes of using
text:
Bought one with high hopes as a Xmas present for my son. After using it for 30 minutes the front axel broke. Got an instant replacement (thank you Amazon) and the second did exactly the same thing except this time it was a rear wheel.

The car itself is highly regarded and has good overall reviews, but my experience was extremely disappointing. The car feels well built and seems like it should withstand more abuse without breaking. We were not doing anything abnormal with it. The car has a mixture of some metal and plastic parts, and sadly the plastic parts did not withstand being run more than 30 minutes before failing where the wheels take stress. One they snap or break it causes other areas to fall apart and the metal axels to fall out (see pictures). Also, the front part of the vehicle completely snapped loose from the chassis. I would suggest sticking with recommended bashers in this price range like a mjx hyper go rc or a slight step up in durability (and price) with a traxxas entry model. I bought an e-revo vxl to replace this.

title: Fast, reliable car that my children love almost as much as me
text:
Bought this for my 7 year old son, I think my 11 year old daughter like it more.

Very fast to accelerate, I tested it very tough dropping it from height on the shock and jumping it over hills. So far 20+ runs on full batteries and not a problem. I run a single battery and change it when it dies. The battery will stop immediately when there is not enough power from it, no degradation of power then stoppage. We accidentally ran it into a curb full speed a few times and I was VERY surprised we did not break the front bumper. Acceleration is really good to top speed within 2 seconds or so, very reactive steering and very accurate.

title: Highly Recommend this Truck for Beginners to Intermediate Users.
text: Truck out of the box required a simple install for the lights which really look cool.  First day with the truck was a breeze, it has great balance and handles the grass effortlessly.  You really notice the oil filled shocks as they gracefully handle any bump thrown it‚Äôs way.

title: I love this RC car
text:
I love this RC car
I have had this rc ca For now About 3 months.
I would say that this is a great RC car for beginners to learn.
The double shocks in the back make it help last longer. the csse completely around the battery electronics make it help easier so dirt and mud sand or snow does not get into the components.
It's just the right size not too big but not to small. The battery life of the both batteries together I would say last for about 30 minutes run time. I've bought bigger batteries that can fit inside of it so I can last up to an hour. The range in the RC car is really good. If picks up my RC car easily throughout any Length I put it on. Not gonna lie of also use this for Halloween during the coronavirus put a bowl of candy in the back of it and delivered that kids sud be free of interaction. And those able to stand the weight of the candy bowl in the back and lasted With the extra help of the 2 batteries I bought the whole entire time for Halloween.
I wish the remote was a little better. I think instead of a high and a low setting they should have put a dial weakened slowly increased speed. So then people that are really not familiar with RC cars they in turn it all the way down to get used to it before they crank it all the way up.
Other in the app I think really good product I've had no problems with it.

title: This rc car is fast and built tough. Awesome!!!!!
text: Honestly this car is great. My son is 10 and has had cheap rc cars in the past, he would use them a couple of times and then they became a thing of the past. That is not the case with this rc car. He lives driving it and because of the two speed levels he was able to ease into getting used to it. This car is fast and very responsive, as a beginner my 10 year old son has really caught on to drive this car well even with how fast it is. Having two batteries is great because the batteries only last about 15 mins. This rc car also is very tough. He has driven it in snow, dirt, grass, and gravel and this thing moves through it all. This rc car has taken a beating with crashes and flips. It is just a beast. The only thing I would complain about so far would be that there is only two other covers for this rc car. I better selection for changing up the look would be cool. Now I want one really bad, and my son wants me to get one as well. We will have to see. Great product.

title: Laegendary Monster Truck, Very fun electric RC
text: This electric dual motor powered RC is very sturdy and fast.  It makes a great beginner unit with the additional High or Low power (speed) setting on the controller.  This gives the younger inexperienced drivers a chance to work their way up to speed.  It is nearly impossible to flip the car sideways because of the wide wheelbase.  There are numerous spare parts available for the unit at the manufacture's website.  The chassis parts are very strong so if you don't run the unit off a roof or something crazy like that, the truck should last a long time before replacing anything.  When I purchased the unit, I checked both Amazon and the Laegendary website for pricing and found the truck to be slightly cheaper on the Laegendary website and with free shipping.  I am extremely pleased with this purchase

I highly recommend this for someone who has driven a little but I would not recommend for someone who has never touched an RC vehicle before.

Ran it with both batteries hooked up, still  not as fast as my other truck.

title: Great Remote control car for the price.
text: This is definitately a step up over the walmart $70.00 remote control cars. This truck is really fast and seems to be very durable. Definately buy a pack of the clips to keep the body on. It doesn't take long to knock them off. Battery life is about 25-30 with my son playing with it out in the street and sidewalks. If you take it to the RC race track on Ram Off Road Way in Colorado Springs, the batter will last about 15 minutes running it hard. I also purchased a third battery when I purchase it so my son is using three batteries, which seems to work out great. In the snow the batteries last about 10 minutes because it has to work so hard against the snow, but it is fast. If you kid has never had an RC car, this is NOT the car for him to start with. Buy a Walmart $60.00 fast car and let him learn to control it. If you don't know how to control it you will quickly crash and destroy it.

We have spent almost a hundred in replacement parts trying to get the car to work for more than ten minutes without falling apart and now it will not connect to the controller. My grandson has only played with this a handful of times since he got it because it keeps breaking down. I thought this was a good quality machine and it wasn't cheap but all I have is a disappointed grandson and a car that hasn't functioned correctly since day one. Do not recommend at all I suggest you find a different company to purchase one from!

title: A great deal on a fun car with some caveats.
text:
The car is very much as described. Extremely fast, pretty good run time when used with two batteries. The one caution is, when set up with two batteries you have to use a velcro strap to hold the batteries in place and you cannot install the regular battery cover. As a result, when used with two batteries the car is no longer waterproof. But apart from that, it really is a very good deal a car that is a lot of fun to drive, very powerful Etc. My kid is very happy. Great value.

We had one issue with steering where, when driven through gravel and mud, a pebble or something got stuck in the works. the vendor was extremely responsive, replying to emails at 3 in the morning with the needed information. I exchanged several messages, all helpful and prompt. I would do business with them again based on this experience.

Update: on a recurrence of the issue they were kind enough to send me a video illustrating how to disassemble the vehicle to resolve the problem without damaging it.

IMPORTANT: THIS IS DEFINITELY NOT FOR INDOOR PLAY, it's much too fast and powerful for that, even at low speed (unless you live in an aircraft hangar). Our seven-year-old can handle it well, but we have to be outside in a large open area.

We are considering buying one or two more, so that we can go out and drive these as a family. :)

title: Beginner RC Car but awesome
text: Looked at a lot of reviews. We have used it 5 times hard since purchase. Made sure to use Blue lock tight on the wheels, nuts and bolts before you run it. After reading other reviews of potential problems we had no issues. Very durable good battery life with twin batts. Hard to put the dual batteries in the compartment for water proof seal but manageable, it is a little bit of a tetris game. Decent price, very fast and fun for all ages, my 6 year old is having a blast. Would recommend keeping it in low until you know how to control it. Its even to fast for me as an adult but I have absolutely no RC experience, we have jumped, slammed, smashed and ran into walls at top speed. It Is Durable!!! I have broke both bumpers and one shock so far so plan on buying some parts!!! I think lock tight is the key touch. Blue should do the trick, red might be to much. All in all, the parts that I have broke on the RC truck. Should have broke a few hits earlier. I'm a heavy Diesel Tech That knows what a part should take, on the punishment aspect; and this thing is durable in my experience with it.  I give it a A++!!!! I would definitely recommend it!!!!!

title: Great truck!
text: This truck is awesome. Period. Not sure about the claimed top speed but definitely fast enough to have some fun! And it‚Äôs solid. My 10 year old ran it into a curb at full speed and the thing was unfazed. The bumper held up fine! A little part of the plastic body broke but I‚Äôll take that! I thought it was going to be toast! Shook off the crash and continued running great. A great truck at a good price. Been running it since October and no issues. Definitely recommend it.

title: Feel like a kid again!
text: Quick, easy to use and durable. Hit several curbs at full speed, drove off like nothing happened. Drove through mud puddles, snow and dirt and did awesome. I wish the battery packs were a bit larger to support longer runtime but for the money this thing is a deal regardless.

title: Very good fast car but hex pin came damaged, resulting in wheel falling off
text: Car ran very good and was a very good, agile fast car. Really good off road/ in the woods. Battery‚Äôs lasted closer to 30 mins when full throttle at top speed non stop but that‚Äôs a given. Only reason I give this car bad stars is right from the start the wheel started falling off, I soon learned it was due to the hex nut being bad resulting in the pin falling out and getting lost, I bought more hex pins for 10$ for 4, & they were just the pins, I soon found out it was the whole hex nut that was bad. But other than that the car is very nice, I just should of contacted support sooner than later to get a new one or just get the hex nuts replaced before just having to pay from pocket.

title: Bad distributor!

title: Awesome Truck! Awesome Value! Fast & Fun!
text:
I can't say enough good stuff about this truck! It has not just 1 but TWO motors powering it! And, at 1:10 scale, it's BIG and it gets attention from bystanders! It jumps and climbs like a pro and on the flat straightaway it's FAST!! Loads of fun!

You get EVERYTHING you need to run this vehicle right out of the box; truck, truck body, 2 li-po batteries, 2 chargers, controller, wrench tool (for tightening wheels), user manual, and some spare parts too (not that you'll need them... this truck is TOUGH!).

IMPORTANT SAFETY TIP: For SAFETY, you should NEVER leave li-po batteries in an RC vehicle between runs (it can be a fire hazard). Thus in this kit, you also get a FIREPROOF "battery bag" included for safely storing your li-po batteries when not running the vehicle.

The only thing not included is 3 AA batteries to power the controller.

A nice added feature is this truck includes REAL LED running lights! The truck looks super-cool w/o the lights but WITH the lights it elevates the beauty of this beast to a new level. The lights are easy to install; just pop the lights into place and plug in the wire into the dedicated power slot provided; done!

The control is responsive, yet easy to master even for beginners. HINT: start out on the 'half speed' setting until you get used to it. Also, be sure to trim the steering so it goes straight when your hand is off the steering wheel (there's a "steering trim" knob right on the controller so this is easy to do!).

This truck is also RUGGED...I really put a beating on it and it held together nicely! The shocks come pre oiled and are top quality.

This truck takes TWO 7.4V 1600mAh Li-Po batteries (included) so you have plenty of power to crank those two engines. With two engines being powered, I was expecting a short (maybe 20 min) of play time but was pleasantly surprised to get DOUBLE that at 40 minutes it was still going strong!

One final thing... Laegendary's support is awesome!... I emailed them that my truck lights didn't seem to work and they wrote me back within hours with the solution (turned out I had the lights plugged in backwards; unplug, reverse, plug in...Wow, Lights!) It's nice to know Laegendary has your back!

In summary, I'm seeing in this truck features and HIGH-QUALITY that are normally only present in much higher priced R/C vehicles! wholly recommend it!

For only a couple weeks of usage this seems a bit excessive to be in need of such repairs and then to have to upgrade other parts just to make repairs to defective items is a bummer. All that money would have bought my son a better truck to start which is why I‚Äôm leaving this review. I‚Äôd buy a better truck and spend the money up front and save yourself the trouble.

Fast and fun. controls worked well, and the option for a slower mode will work well for a child learning to get used to it. seems very sturdy, but i will update that after we have a real chance to play in a couple weeks. overall very happy so far. **Update - Love this truck. The difference in quality between this truck and the other vehicle purchased at similar price is huge. The chassis construction is solid, with everything sealed and covered. Performance is fantastic. fast and durable. Already ran it into a mailbox post by accident and no damage. Obviously results there will vary.... Jumping it is the norm with my kids.  Been running it in the snow without any issues. Not sure if that is recommended but I have not had any problems even with the melting snow when I bring it inside. title: Affordable RC truck that's very durable and surprisingly fast!
text: [[VIDEOID:7303b6cbc2ad6d895e9dd8bce524c31a]] I've always been a fan of RC cars and have recently gotten my kids interested as well.  Decided to purchase this truck after reading reviews and figured the cost was worth trying it out.  I was a bit shocked (and ultimately thrilled) with how quick, nimble and durable this truck is.  We've played with this truck on asphalt, grass, dirt and gravel and it simply rips.  Truck can easily do donuts, power slides and launch small jumps. Batteries charge a bit slow but luckily there are 2 chargers (1 for each battery) so you can charge both at the same time.  This was originally purchased as my kids first outdoor RC truck but I end up playing with it just as much!!!!

title: First impression - very cool
text:
I was not expecting much for this price. I just needed something for the grandson (26 months old). He loves monster trucks and I have been looking for a hobby.

This thing really goes! It has been 30+ years since I was into RC cars so my grading scale is a little dated.

It seems sturdy. The body is slick and looks like it should last.

The run time with one battery is - as advertised - right around 30 minutes.

Since I just got it I can't comment on its longevity

title: Christmas
text: This was purchased for a Christmas present so it hasn't been opened or used but looks to have some good features at a really good price. Will have to see after we use it how it runs.

title: It‚Äôs alright
text:
First and foremost straight out of the box I have had nothing but connection issues with receiver and truck. I set it on my counter paired it and the truck came alive on its own and full power off the counter into my sons forehead. Then I couldn‚Äôt get it to pair for 10 min after even though it says it is paired. On day 2 I still have issues pairing it‚Äôs a process every single time. I am NOT a fan of such difficulty for a beginners hobby grade truck.

Speed is alright. Truck is fun but still much slower than my stock 2wd traxxas slash. But I paid $120 for it and I wish I would have paid $99 or less. It will do wheelies uphill but feels light when driving like it wants to float constantly.

Overall I‚Äôd give it a 3/10 rating and only because it seems well built and I still have fun with it but I would much rather have spent another $100 and went with the aarma 4x4 1/10 truck.

title: Rough and tumble toy
text: This is great! We bought it for our 7 year old and he loves it, but my husband also loves it. We found out the range is incredible as my younger son accidentally drove it on the street and 4 houses up from ours. It has had many a crash and flip and still going strong.

title: Decent car for the $, but not incredible
text:
This is a decent car for the price, although I got it on sale and probably would not have paid full price. My son likes it, which is all that really matters.
However, we've driven it probably 6-10 times and have already broken the steering servo, a shock popped it seal, and the front steering cup ball joint wore out and required replacement. Granted we may drive ever so slightly harder than others, but you really can't get too crazy with this car, so I would have expected the parts to last a lot longer than that. FWIW, all of those parts I mentioned are the same as another brand and a few bucks cheaper (if you search the part number the other brand will also show up with similar numbers).
The transmitter has a nice feel and is responsive, but on occasion the receiver goes haywire on startup and the car wants to drive itself, so make sure you're holding it on power up (yes, my transmitter is always turned on first, it still freaks out sometimes).
Also, I was replacing the tire and over-tightened the nut in the cvd drive shaft, which snapped shaft. I honestly wasn't putting much force on it, but apparently that was too much, so I replaced that as well.
Overall the car drives pretty well. I wouldn't call it crazy fast by any means, but faster than a cheapo $20-$50 car for sure. I probably wouldn't buy it again, I would much rather pay a little more and get a name-brand lower end car like a rustler, but I'm not disappointed in this purchase either.

title: Great rc 4x4 car reverse problem solved
text: Some on here mentioned that the transmitter is slow to respond to reverse. I too have noticed this with my unit. I am not sure but it may be either a defective trigger switch or it may be a protection delay to keep from ripping the gears apart from harsh direction changes under power. Not sure yet but it feels like it was made that way. ""UPDATE"" It isn't a problem with reverse. One push into reverse while going forward gives you "brakes" and two quick pushes into reverse makes it go backwards. solved

title: Terrible Connectivity Between Car and Remote....Plan On Being Disappointed
text:
I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS ITEM:

We‚Äôve had this remote control car for approximately 7 months. In that time, we‚Äôve used it approximately 20 times.

Connectivity with the car is a huge issue and the car frequently drives on its own and crashes into curbs, cars, etc. when it loses connection with the remote. I‚Äôve reset it several times and it still has the same issues whether we are in a remote area or in a city.

Despite all of its great attributes, the connectivity is a huge drawback to this product and it prevents me from providing a positive review.

If someone knows of a way to fix this, please let me know.

Pros:
-Fast.....much faster than I expected. Approximately 20MPH down our street...probably faster
-Fairly well built....several crashes have occurred where I expected something to break and nothing did
-Seemingly good value

Cons:
-No LED lighting
-One of the two batteries it came with would not charge. The manufacturer would not send another one because I contacted them approximately 2-3 months after purchase
-The On/Off Switch has broken by me attempting to turn it off...huge problem
-The remote control regularly loses connectivity with the vehicle even when a fully charged battery is in the car and in the remote.

title: If anything breaks within the first two weeks - send it back immediately for a replacement
text:
This RC/Car broke after 4 hours of use. The lights worked, the wheels turned but no motor. Probably just the EMC. They sent me a replacement within 2 days, before I had time to send the broken one back. This one worked for 5 hours then the front servo started making a noise and the car would only turn to the right. I sent it back for a full refund. Which 12 days later I have yet to receive from Amazon.Com. Not sure what the hold up is. Can't find a phone number or e-mail address to contact them.
I had also bought 4 extra batteries that I never used so I sent them back also with no problems. I liked the car, when it runs. Good traction on dirt and sand. Fast on hard surface. Didn't try to do jumps with it. Great beginners car. It has a low and high speed which is good to learn on driving for the first time.Not sure how easy it is to get parts, worth checking out. Not sure if it can be upgraded to run faster. I would buy the insurance - not sure what it covers, probably worth looking into. Seems well built, good skid plates underneath. I might suggest installing a stronger servo motor. Probably why mine broke. Not that expensive and probably a YouTube video would show you how to replace it. I was going to mount my GoPro Hero7 Black camera on the hood of the car, and also inside the car, but unfortunately never got the chance. I have a 3-axis gimbal that I was also going to mount on the car for the GoPro to get some super stable POV shots but I will try out that set up when I get my new car. I have ordered a Redcat Shredder. I decided to pay a little more money and get a better built car. Redcat has every replacement part with numbers and pictures for all their cars plus they tell you just how to upgrade your EMC, shocks, motor, battery upgrades, charging systems,servo,and gears etc, for faster and better performance and handling.. https://www.amazon.com/Redcat-Racing-Shredder-Electric-Truck/dp/B073SZJMNF/ref=sr_1_1?dchild=1&keywords=redcat+shredder&qid=1598382861&sr=8-1
You can download both the Shredder and Laegenday car manuals and this is a good way to compare the two cars. I'm new to RC so this is what I have learned just in the last 6 weeks. I have joined a few R/C car forums that have good info on maintaining you car and answering all your questions. Great sport. You can join a racing club nearby or just have tons of fun driving it with your friends.

title: Get it now!! This is the best one out there at this price rangeüëçüèº
text:
Great rc truck! It's fast, durable, and great looking basher! It has a ton of torque and many upgradable parts! Great entry to the rc hobby world! For the price, your looking at a lot of high quality parts that you would find in a more expensive rc truck. The oil filled metal shocks, metal a-arms, metal transmission shaft, metal drive cups, foam filled rubber tires, the double motor, bright light kit, this thing is a beast! It's great for for kids as well as adults! The version I purchased is the "Blue & Yellow." I purchased it through Legendary.com because Amazon at the time sold out.
As you can see from my photos, I also purchased a 5200 mAh Li-Po battery that came with a strap to secure it onto the vehicle. I also purchased a Li-Po charger that can charge the 5200mah properly. This by the way also comes with 2 1600 mAh Li-Po batteries that you can combine for longer playtime. There is actually enough room in the battery compartment to fit both batteries and be able to close the lid securely.
I haven't been in the RC car life since I was a kid and getting back into this hobby with this Legendary truck has fueled my passion once again!!

title: It can make a 58 year old man a kid again!
text: [[VIDEOID:573b9bfadd99e3f8560762c293a53455]] So I asked my husband what he wanted for Christmas. So my husband has stage 4 cancer and is in his recliner or the couch most of the day. So he said don‚Äôt laugh but I want this car. So I went on amazon found it, read the reviews and I know it said problems with batteries but I order it for my husband anyways. So let me just say that my husband is like a kid again this gift was priceless. My husband has never owned a remote control car and he‚Äôs not very tech savvy. However this great for beginners I took this video the day after we received it. He has it on low speed and lives playing with it in our living room. I came out to check up on him at 3am and he was playing with his car! Best feeling ever dealing with a life threatening disease and how a little car can make him so happy. He said he‚Äôs ready for the next car!!!! I recommend this car yes it‚Äôs a bit pricey but the quality is their. The battery last about 30-40min but he‚Äôs using it around the house only because he doesn‚Äôt want to get it dirty. So maybe the next purchase we will make it his out door car because he does want to try out side. I put shoes in the way and it goes over it no problem!
