title: Great Customer Service! Fun car at a great price point!
text: I purchased this car as my first R/C car to start my hobby and it definitely delivered. It was very fun, fast, and easy to control. I did have the rear differential break after a few weeks (The only reason I gave 4 not 5 stars) but when I reached out to the support team they got back with me fairly promptly and sent me a new part within a week. I also asked for a "How-to" video and they sent one along as well (Not the greatest video because it was not specific to my problem but had enough info to get me through it). Overall this was a great purchase and I recommend this as a beginner truck to jump into the world of R/C cars

title: Easy to Operate
text: RC truck is already to use out of the box (just add batteries to the remote control and to the car). I found it best to start using the truck on the low speed mode, then graduated to the high speed. It is very quick and learning to use does not take too much time.

title: Great Machine
text:
I've bought 2 of these beautiful Machines for my boys, about 5 months ago. They race it nearly every day and absolutely love them. They are built tough, run fast and so much fun. Great battery life also 40+ minutes.
Excellent seller. Will purchase again.

title: Crazy Fast!
text: We received this remote control quickly and the communication with the seller has been fantastic.  They have answered every single question that we've had from battery placement to replacement parts (That's what happens when you gift a car this fast to a nine-year old-lol) My only issue is, the description makes it sound like you can have both batteries connected tot he car at once which is not the case.  There just isn't room.  It doesn't affect the quality of this product at all.  This car is ridiculously fast and can stop and turn on a dime.  It also can run through the lawn with as much ease as on the road.  I would absolutely recommend both this seller and this product.

title: So Far So Good
text: Everything it claims to be, plus a lot of fun. I Have not had it long enough to comment on reliability but the build quality suggests I will not be disappointed.

title: This is my second one, that's all I gotta say
text: I demolished my first one so bad, I had to buy another one because I just blatantly abused and broke it. The only thing I don't like is the front bumper part. It breaks easily and I went through several of them until I reinforced it with metal pieces I bought from a hardware store and glued them into place, now it breaks things instead of it being broke...well, the bumper that is. Definitely worth the money and only the bumper is sub-adequate.

title: Great first "real" RC car
text: As advertised.  Hobby quality performance out of the box for my 10 year old.  He loves it.  Even rips through a couple inches of snow without a problem. Perfect Xmas gift.

title: Super fun! Worth every penny!
text:
This truck definitely meets my expectations of what an RC car should be, straight out of the box.

It's fast, powerful, responsive, durable, and the double battery configuration allows for double the play time!

One thing worth mentioning: It's a 4WD, but the front wheels have all the main power, so it behaves a little like a front-wheel drive. So, if you want to do donuts, you'll have to do them in reverse.

Also, be sure you have enough wide-open space for play, because crashing isn't driving, nor will it be fun.

All-in-all, I'm extremely happy with this purchase! I even payed for the over-night shipping, and it arrived the next day!

title: This is an awesome toy!
text: This toy makes everyone jealous... it's so fun... my 8-year-old loves it.  He's had it for two years and still plays with it all the time.

title: Great

title: everything you need

title: Grandson luved it
text: Easy to use out of the box. Just needed to have AA batteries handy. It was a kid and dad magnet.

title: Have extra parts handy
text:
Edited to say literally less than an hour after he opened it and had everything charged, it broke. He was supervised and wasnt doing anything crazy. I know that even more expensive RC cars need to have parts replaced pretty regularly, but really? That quickly? Very disappointed.

My son got hooked on RC cars from a neighbor friend, but being he's younger I didn't want to spend hundreds of dollars on a car he could destroy right out of the gate. I ordered this car for Easter, and not only did it come ahead of schedule, it came in another box so I could hide the surprise.

The box is well designed, and everything had a place. Nothing was broken, and everything was perfectly packaged. We opened it up and immediately charged the batteries. Took about 2 hours to charge 1 battery, and he's been playing with it ever since. I'm thinking I'll pick up a few extra batteries just to have charged so we can play longer.

Overall, I'm pretty pleased. I read countless reviews on several cars before landing on this one. So far, well worth the price for the pure joy he has :)

title: Awesome RC car!
text:
This is a great car for the price. The half speed option on the controller is great for small children and the car is tough! The switch is a bit weak so I cut the lever off close to the housing. Seems to have fixed the issue. The front lower ball joints on both sides popped out so I added a 3mm washer and it hasn't happened again. The washer didn't interfere with the suspension travel of my car.
I had some communication with the company laegendary and they were simply amazing! Best customer service experience I've had in a long time.

title: Very well built
text: This truck is very well built and have had no issues with it.  I especially love the fact that it comes with 2 batteries.  The truck runs very nicely on street, dirt, and grass.  It is so powerful that you have to be careful when turning or it will flip and taking off as it will do a wheelie very easily :)

title: Very well built

text: Easily on par with "hobby shop" kits that are triple the price.  Complete kit, 2 speed controls and super fun.  Enough said!

title: For a beginner this car is great!!!
text: This car is the first "Adult" RC Car I have driven. I have had it for only one day. So far I am learning how to control it with the transmitter and having a ball. One issue I have is that the manual shows a slide switch for operating the car power but the car I have has a pushbutton switch. this was a little confusing. Thankfully one of the questions asked in Amazon concerned this issue. The manual needs to be updated or a correction sheet added since the pushbutton needs to be held down until the light comes on to link to the controller. I am working through the one battery breakin for the motor brushes with the car in low speed and reduced turning radius on a hard smooth surface. I am looking forward to getting more confident and moving up to racing the machine,

title: Brakes much faster than model that cost less than half.

title: So much fun!
text: Been wanting to get back into the RC hobby that I enjoyed so much as a kid growing up. After some searching I wanted something that wouldn't break the bank, but still perform well. I came across the Legend in a few Youtube videos and decided to order it. Everything was ready to go out of the box with, I just had to charge the batteries and away we go! This is an impressive little unit. Its fast and I managed to smash it into a few things and it just keeps going. Obviously time will tell how well it holds up, but I am loving the time I've spent with it so far and would recommend it to anyone.

title: Durable and fast!
text: We unfortunately tried out a different RC car first (NOT the Legend, one from another company) and it had electronic problems within the first week. The Legend seems like a big upgrade - durable, well-made, easy to control, and fast! This is for our son, so as you can imagine, he puts it to the test - so far, passing with flying colors! We looked at a LOT of different ones online to find the right one - we highly recommend this one!

title: Won't be disappointed and excellent customer support!
text:
Update: I had a small issue with my truck and Laegendary customer service was very fast and responsive. They helped me and fixed the problem asap. Thanks Laegendary!

Great truck, been running it for 4 days now. Works as it should. I own other major brand trucks and I would still recommend this one to someone looking for a nice monster truck. I like the dual battery option and shocks better on this truck vs similar models. My 4 year old son is obsessed with it and is able to drive it.

title: The Battery Life and Battery Storage
text: [[VIDEOID:ec2917e20d4137b769db42bc11a3874d]] This is a good car, but there are two concerns about this car. One, the battery life didn't last as long as they said it would. The battery should've last around 20 minutes, but only lasted 13-15 minutes. The second concern is the battery storge. It is almost impossible to put both batteries in the car. You can only fit one battery. I was able to both batteries in the car, but the batteries were pushing the lid up and water got in the battery compartment. But with one battery, this car can definitely handle snow. I would recommend buying one bigger battery to fit in the battery compartment and last longer. But other than those two concerns, this is a great car.

I didn‚Äôt bother contacting the seller after the latest issue.

title: Fantastic truck for the money, New Model Jan 2020
text:
This is my first RC truck but my kids had them when they were young. You see, I am retired and got 2 trucks for 2 of my my grandkids and I sort of got the fever to get one to play with for myself. This is a super truck for a first timer or even someone who just wants a "Basher" to play around with. I'm not sure why it has dual shocks on the rear, maybe just a selling thing. I removed 1 set because it was too stiff on the rear, but it was super easy to do.
The LED lights are super cool.
This is now the newer model and even comes with a large enough battery compartment to hold both batteries and has 2 little locks to hold it on. It used to require a strap to hold them both on.
It also has a newer style push push on off switch, which I had heard was a bad thing on the older model.
My only trouble is that the batteries take way too long to recharge, like 2 hours or more. I hope that they can improve on this.
But for the money, it's a super great little truck. Super battery life. Great speed. I have used it mostly in low range.

text: This product is what the description says it is and delivery happened when it said.  I bought this RC for my sons 10th birthday. title: Better than our double priced redcat
text: [[VIDEOID:4e9dd566d7117e08f98ae61d4af4e148]] My 11 year old purchased a redcat rc for double the price and upgraded his batteries. My 7 year old got this one for his birthday. I didn‚Äôt want something too crazy expensive, but he wanted something faster than normal rc cars. Long story short, my 11!year old is MAD. This car is hands down faster for less than half the price, with no upgrades. The redcat‚Äôs suspension handles a little better. Being able to use 2 batteries at once is great. I love that batter is fully enclosed. My 12 year old has to really clean his well after each use because it‚Äôs all exposed. My husband is REALLY surprised at how great this truck is. Only used it for 2 days, so can‚Äôt comment on its longevity but I will update if it doesn‚Äôt last or things break easily.

title: Easy setup.
text: Loved the fast delivery.

title: Well made and fast, but lacking customer service
text:
This car appears to be very well made with a strong chassis. The battery lift is great and charges in a reasonable time. However, when I noticed some defects to the suspension right out of the box, I contacted Team LAEGENDARY to get assistance with replacement parts and they did not fully deliver what I was expecting. One shock was leaking oil and the other had a missing bracket for the spring. They agreed to help with the replacements but I had to pay half the cost of the new shocks when the issues were not caused or influenced by myself. So me as the customer had to pay for the company's mistake... I was not very happy about that.

Overall I think the car is great and I understand quality issues happen but I am not happy that I had to pay for replacing parts that were received defective.

title: First RC driving vehicle and it's a winner (so far)
text:
Had been eyeing this for a while as it looked like the best sub high-end option and the reviews didn't seem fake, also very impressed with the company's responses to questions and problems. I'd forgotten about this thing and wasn't specifically looking but came across it somehow for 20% off on Prime Day (I'm sure Jeff Bezos reminded me that I needed it). I'm glad he did because he was right, I totally needed it. Had it out in 4-5 inch high grass and it's truly awesome. I started on half-speed which is a brilliant option (maybe they all have this) and off it went at maybe 8-10 MPH. I saw something shoot up in the air on a tight turn and my hopes were dashed with me thinking something had broken and flown off...but it was just leaves and assorted lawn stuff getting shot up in the air from the force of the tires...on slow speed. On high speed we were at around 16-18 mph and it was awesome. With low cut grass it would probably get to 25 mph (tried this the next day, probably got to around 20)...without a huge yard you may not want it to get much faster. Response seemed very good and reverse had it powering out of a few garden beds with ease. I drove it slowly into a soccer ball to get my dog's attention and at slow speeds it seems like a climbing monster...it actually climbed over the ball...I think that's called torque and this thing must have that in spades. Range was impressive, I've got 100 yards and had it out about 70 so far with no issues.

At any rate, like I said I've never used one of these before, so I can't compare it to anything. My guess is that I chose correctly and anything else would be a letdown. My only regret is that I didn't buy two on Prime Day, though to me it is easily worth the the $160 or so regular price. Racing and smashing two of these together would be super cool; also, though it says '14 and older' on the box, it's simple to drive and a 7 year old should have no problem handling it...just start on slow mode.

One thing: Upon turning the truck on it sometimes gets stuck on a and races away. I think its because you need to turn the car on before the receiver, or vice versa. This caused it to smash into a table and knock over and break a pot. Apparently it hit the metal table at full speed and there wasn't a scratch on the truck or even the shell that I could see.

Well done, Laegendary, whoever you are.

Update: reached out to Laegendary regarding the throttle issue; they were incredibly responsive and have shipped out a new controller. I think this is a rebranded Hosim as they look exactly the same but with a few upgrades. Hosim has now come out with a similar upgraded unit. Regardless , if that's the case the key differentiater is service, and this company has really shown brightly in that regard, though they are a young company, so you never know what the future holds. For the non-rabid enthusiast, I don't see how this can be beat, especially if you can grab one during a sale.

Seller communication has been great, just received my free bag of shell clips. Again, I can't see how a $300-$500 'hobby grade' model could add any more value. Looking forward to trying it in the snow and hoping for a brushless version.

title: Good RC entry choice. Way too fast for indoors, outdoors is a blast!!!
text:
This little truck runs very fast. The remote has a good range, takes your car as far as you can barely see it to maneuver it back. The combination of tires and suspensions makes it easy to be controlled on rough terrain. However, it can be flipped easily, if that happens you will need to reset it by hand. (Can‚Äôt somebody design a spring arm to automatically engage when the car it‚Äôs on it's back, to kick it over?!)
The battery connector is short and awkward to align with the pack to set everything in the compartment for the cover to fit over. It‚Äôs even more of a challenge for the same reason to figure out a way to align two packs to strap to the body of the car. And of course the battery cover can‚Äôt be used with two packs.
The switch to turn the car on and off is impossible to reach without removing the car's shell. At first I thought it to be a drawback. But considering the fact that you need to remove it anyway to put fresh packs in, it doesn‚Äôt matter anymore.
Putting back the pins takes a bit of getting used to. A small plier may come in handy. For little fingers is less of a challenge.
I have purchased two cars at the same time so my kids can race each other. They are happy and enjoy them a lot. I had to tape one car and the controller with masking tape to differentiate between the two. It would be nice if LAEGENDARY would produce two different shells for the same car, to help with distinguishing between them in my case (and maybe others, I don‚Äôt know?!).
The purchase happened a week ago. Not enough time to see how durable the assemblies are, that is to be determined.

Bottom line, in my experience, this car is amazing, and definitely the right one for anyone who's looking for their first RC car!

title: Fun, fast and easy to control... for now?
text:
The car comes pre-assembled with charged battery, so it's easy to start. The car is easy to control and quite fast. So far it's a lot of fun. However, the plastic body had two corners bent. Also, I purchased this on Prime Day with 100 free pins supposedly. But there were no free pins in the box, instead just a brochure with a link to a website to "claim the free product", which then requires to enter your address and email (which I didn't want to do but did anyway) but the website doesn't work. In other words, no free pins. For the bent body and that, I am removing 2 stars.

Update 1: the seller sent me a replacement plastic body. Apparently I should be getting the missing pins as well, although I haven't gotten them. But great customer care to reach back and offer the replacement body! I added back one star for now.

Update 2: I received the free pins. Added back the missing star.

Update 3: Now I am having an issue with the car veering off at top speed without using the RC, and not being able to use the RC to stop it once it starts. It did so 3 times. I emailed the seller, and got a prompt reply asking for a video of the issue to investigate further, as they had not seen this before. I am keeping the review at 4 stars while this is being investigated. This latest issue is troublesome but so far the customer care has been great. Will update when I have a resolution.

title: Worth the money for entry level hobby.
text:
This thing is incredible. Fast, rugged and sensitive. Bought this as a ‚Äúfather/son‚Äù hobby. We broke it out of the package this morning and could hardly wait for the batteries to charge.

Once charged, we immediately got to ripping around the yard and terrorizing the dogs. If my sons head wasn‚Äôt attached, it would have fallen off as he was laughing so hard. Even at eight years old, he was able to maneuver and master this quickly.

We have some concerns: you must be an engineer to manage to get two batteries connected inside the battery compartment at the same time. Clearly I‚Äôm far from being an engineer as I spent the better part of 10 minutes trying to manage this. After 10 minutes, we just put one battery in and started playing.

The battery charger seems pretty basic. Based on a lot of the battery reviews, we‚Äôll likely upgrade the charger (it‚Äôs no more than a cable and a USB wall plug) to an actual hobby level charger.

The cotter pins that hold the body on are difficult but manageable. Not something my son can do without a tool.

First impressions are tough to beat. And this thing has truly won both of us. Both batteries lasted about 20+ minutes at half power through a mix of grass, leaves and some crusted snow. It‚Äôs on the pricier side of entry level cars, but we certainly aren‚Äôt disappointed and look forward to lots of hours with this.

title: So Much Fun!!!
text:
This truck is for me, not a child or a gift.

I haven't had an RC truck since about 1987 so I'm super rusty at driving them. This truck has 2 modes, fast and slow, so you can learn how to drive it on slow mode then graduate to the faster setting. It's a lot of fun to drive and the fact that it's 4-wheel drive means it can get itself out of a lot of the binds that driving in the back yard can cause. It comes with 2 batteries so you can either use them together for a single longer use, or you can use them individually so 2 people can race it and you just trade it out when it starts slowing down.

I love it!!!

title: A really great RC car
text:
Immediately upon getting the car out of its box I am really happy with the overall product!
The build quality feels premium, there's a good weight to the chassis and the exterior shell is flexible and resistant to bumps. There's a sturdy front and rear bumper guarding all the important internals. Most importantly, it comes with a dual battery connector and you can connect 2 batteries at the same time. That way, the driving time increases. I can't stress how fun it is to actually drive this car... it's really quick, sharp and responsive steering, and plenty of power to jump over obstacles and pull impressive high-speed turns. The agility when you throw it into brake / reverse is fantastic, allowing you to spin 180¬∞ and come to a skid stop with minimal effort.

If I were to change anything, it would be to make the on/off switch more accessible. (You have to remove the body cover to get to it, and the switch is tiny. My son struggles to flip the switch with his finger, but perhaps this is incentive to stop chewing his finger nails)

title: Fast and fun
text:
Bought this for all three of my kids to use, but my 6 year old really gravitated to it so we use it as a way to teach how to work on it, change battery, put in clips, etc. Just ordered the headlight kit and he is excited to help me install it when it comes in.

This is a great RC package for the money. It is surprisingly fast and easy to control with a little practice. Range is good and the truck can get out of most jams unless it gets high centered or flips on it's back. Really well balanced for drifting and a lot of fun out in the yard, on driveway, gravel, etc. I've ordered two more batteries and extra charger so we can have more run time.

My only minor complaint is the steering doesn't stay centered. When you adjust it, it tends to drift slightly right or left. This is not a big deal but would be nice when at top speed on a straight away to not have to nudge it back and forth. I've also replaced the power switch once already in first month (comes with a spare) and ordered a new one from the OEM website. Seems to get sand and dust in it and becomes hard to move the switch so the plastic slider breaks off. A switch cover would be an improvement that is easy to make. We've also lost most of the body clips. When the truck flips, the clips get pulled out somehow. I ordered the 100 pack of replacements.

Again, a lot of fun and amazed how much power the dual motors deliver to the wheels from these light Li battery packs. Hard to beat this package at this price.

title: Great Car, Lots of Fun
text: I love this thing, it's a lot of fun! Great speed, turning radius, runtime, off road capabilities. It's all around a great RC Car! I would however not pay full price. The first one I received did not have a functioning reverse, the second didn't seem too fast until it started spasming, turning, speeding, and moving on its own. We turned it off and back on and it's like it hit a new level and finally runs as advertised. Another downside is replacement parts, a spring on a shock already fell off after 2 uses and Amazon customer service sent me the wrong part twice and ultimately I had to pay extra for the correct part in another brand (Hosim). This alone was a headache and in some way needs to be simplified so replacement parts can easily be found.

title: Durability a challenge
text:
I really was optimistic about this product. Came with everything to get going and price was reasonable.

Out of the box I was very impressed. Easy to get up and running, fast, and agile.

But things started falling apart from there. Within 5 runs (about 20 min each) I had 4 repairs. 1st repair was a wheel coming off, no worries as an extra nut was provided and bolted back on. Then I had a bunch of breakages. 1 breakage came out of nowhere, front steering plastic broke. Bought a part, fixed it. Then multiple other repairs followed. One was a result of turning on the controller and the car taking off without touching the trigger.

Overall I spent more time repair and putting exta $$ into this vehicle. I looked at an upgrade and found the AARMA Granite for about $60 more and the quality is multiple times better.

Suggest you look elsewhere and spend a little more if durability is important.

title: Ok, but not worth the money. Not durable.
text: I purchased this car at a great price, but unfortunately I cannot say that it held up well. After only about a month the upper control arms broke and are unfixable. Additionally, the wheels continually loosen. At the current price of over $150 (or even $170), I cannot recommend this car. Soft plastic chassis, soft plastic control arms and other suspension components, lack of available spare parts. Spend only a little bit more money and you can solve all of these issues instead of being stuck with a $150 paperweight after a month. It was decently fast when it did work--but not 35mph off road. controls were ok. Of course none of this matters if the thing is broken, as mine currently is.

title: Buyer beware... ball joint and differential  issues, three stars now..
text:
Another update for January 1st, 2020. I had to replace both differentials and the driveshaft to get the car back into working condition. Take careful note of the scarcity of parts for the truck. I had to buy off of eBay to find the parts. The washer hack for the lower ball joints did work. So far my son has put about 40 hours on the truck. Avoid running it in sand or water, it will pre-maturely wear the components out and cause the switch to bind.

This my second review. Also my 2nd truck... the first was returned within 30 days as the lower front ball joints start to pop after several hours of moderate use. Customer service was a huge disappointment in that they were dragging a resolution in spite of sending them pictures... which I added below.. The second truck has started popping ball joints again but Im going to try the 3mm flat washer fix mentioned in the comments. Its fun when it works but now it breaks down too quickly. Update 10/20/19. The washer hack worked like a charm no more popped ball joints. Latest issue is the rear differential is blown out so the car has lost half its drive power to the wheels. Ordered two new ones and they should have arrived today. I am starting to become concerned about replacement parts availability for this car....not sure it was worth the $$ spent

title: Expensive Money Pit
text: [[VIDEOID:274759ea421d64cd27575b029a7d1e01]] I purchased this rc car for my son‚Äôs birthday. Out of the box I was impressed with how fast is was and how balanced it was. After 2 uses I had to to replace a shock because a clip fell of if it and I couldn‚Äôt just buy a clip so the entire shock was purchased. After about 10 uses the all wheel drive stopped working and I only had power to the front wheels. Coincidentally this failure happened 3 days after the return period. I reached out to the company and they told me to send videos so that an engineer could trouble shoot what the problem was, and to attach my original purchase invoice. I did that and I was hoping they would replace the defective part or replace the car. The company told me I need to buy new gears for the motors. So after $200 and 10 uses later I need to buy more parts for this rc car. I understand a hobby rc car will need new parts but after only 10 uses this should not be an issue. To put icing on the cake, the parts needed are not available and on back order. I would spend a little more money and purchase an rc car from a more well known manufacturer next time. This car is a waste of money.

title: Awesome RC
text: Pretty awesome hobby grade RC truck.  It is very fast on the high speed setting and the lower speed setting is great for getting used to it at first and extending drive time.  Seems quite durable so far.  Have had it about a week.  It‚Äôs been driven hard a lot and crashed hard several times.  The two included batteries give about an hour of play time when used one at a time.  I haven‚Äôt tried plugging in both batteries at once yet.  It performs well on pavement, dirt, and out in the yard.  So far I can‚Äôt be happier with this product.  It‚Äôs fine for kids too.  After gaining some experience driving toy store grade rc cars my 5 year old son was able to get the hang of this truck in no time.  He is able to drive it at high speed under total control.  I‚Äôm going to buy another one soon so we can race.  Highly recommend!

title: Great RC Car
text:
Purchased for an 8 year old. It‚Äôs great! The half speed is still quite fast, but manageable for them. It‚Äôs been used and abused in the last week, but still holding together very well. Scratched up, but that‚Äôs what the bumpers and body are for.

We tested the water proof capabilities. It was driven through a huge puddle. After looking, the battery compartment was wet, but I think that‚Äôs OK, because I have not had any problems.

Battery Use... runs a lot longer than expected with 1 battery. Could be because it‚Äôs on half speed, but we were driving it for 20+ min without switching to the 2nd battery.

Battery Charging... came with a USB charger, and a 110v charger. Both charge in about 3 hours.

This is a great starter RC car. Grass or on the street, the whole neighborhood has been having a lot of fun with it. Worth every penny.

title: This is the last car you will ever need.
text: This truck is amazing! It is very fast so, I would say it is not for a beginner, but it does have a low and high setting to get adjusted. Although this truck is very durable, every part is also replaceable so it can very well be the only one you will ever have to buy. I bought this version instead of cheaper options because Legendary has great customer service, it comes with oil shocks which prevents bouncing and instability, and the extra battery makes it possible to run for a solid half hour. They even include a card to claim 100 free body clip pins because those things are small and can easily get lost. Seriously, stop thinking about it and GET THIS CAR!

text: Update! My 3, 4, 6 year old boys and I have abused this truck for 4 months now and it is holding up great. This truck is a blast! We have ripped both bumpers off but only because we have slammed it against solid items at full speed. Good news is that bumpers are only $8 and are available with Prime 2 day shipping. I feel like the runtime is appropriate, I‚Äôm still using mine in ‚Äúkids mode‚Äù with 1 battery and I get 30 minutes use out of each battery. I do like to put it in high mode occasionally to really rip, it can easily do donuts in high. Controller feels solid and is very simple to use and make changes to like switching from low to high or adjusting the steering. My kids usually have to remind me we bought it as a ‚Äúfamily gift‚Äù. title: So Much Fun
text: This car is fast...from a stop position you need to be careful not to full throttle while in hi speed or it may do a back flip.  Still getting used to the steering in smaller areas but in the open it is great.  It has take on some rough driving from me and my son, tumbling often, but it is very durable and rugged and we flip it back on it's wheels and keep on having fun.  It comes with a few extra body pins but get extras because you will need them.  Only negative I can say at this point is I wish they had a better, easier/quicker system to remove the body but that doesn't effect quality of this car.

title: Fun vehicle but already replacing parts
text:
The car itself is a lot of fun, even for me as an adult user. It is very fast and the battery charges up pretty quick. Customer services has been incredibly responsive via direct email communication initiated through their website.

With that said, after my third run of the car, there was a wobble in the front left wheel and I have just been advised that I need to purchase a $15 replacement part set to correct it. This is quite disappointing after having the car for less than one week.

If you are considering this vehicle, I would read the instruction manual carefully before purchasing (available on the Amazon order page) and do your research on brushless motors.

title: I love it

title: awesome rc car
text: I bought the car for myself. just received it today. charging the batteries as I type this review. the product arrived in great condition. easy to follow instructions. I will follow up with another review after I have some fun!!

title: Birthday Bash in Sequoia
text:
Spent my son's 6th birthday in Kings Canyon National Park. On arrival, he was presented with a big gift, the Legend 1:10 truck. Let me tell you that we bashed this truck as hard as we could, by launching off of boulders and over some seriously rough terrain. I can tell you that the bottom of the truck is pretty nicked up, but everything held up nicely. I'm sure I'll be looking to replace suspension components in the coming months, but running perfect for now.

As mentioned, my son just turned 6 and is having the time of his life learning to control the power of this thing. It will remain in low for now, but I couldn't imagine wanting much more speed unless you just want to rip up and down the street.

title: Quality purchase
text: This was purchased for our son‚Äôs 10 year birthday. It has been perfect so far. No issues. It has taken a beating so far and is still great!

title: As advertised
text: Work's great really fast everything just as advised I see why they send an extra on/off switch it's been about a week and mine broke already but that's a small issue haven't had time to play much but so far it's been good

title: Very fun to drive!
text: My 11 year old son loves this RC car. It is so fast and it can do lots of jumps! A must for tween boys!

title: On sale this can‚Äôt be beat!
text: When these go on sale they are a steal, you can‚Äôt buy a better 4WD RC truck that does 30mph easily and will actually stand up to abuse. The battery life on this is amazing and I routinely get 30-40mins going all out on a track, grass, mud, etc and is hard to get it stuck. The LED lights are awesome at night and really light up so you can easily drive it, going forward I want lights on all my RC vehicles because they look so cool The only cons are the remote control is pretty basic with alright distance, the wheels you need to keep tabs on and tighten up after each use usually, the battery compartment with 2 batteries is pretty tight. Cant complain much for the price. I‚Äôm honestly pretty hard on this thing and it takes abuse very well, you will be surprised. Believe the reviews!

title: Very Durable.  Again flawless. only lost 1 pin so far on latest purchase. This one is much faster.
text: Used it for pulling wire long distances in ceilings for work! Flawless!  I now have three actively working. Plus, they are the best fun an adult can have fully clothed!

You could not go to the hobby store and build one like it for the price I paid, also great to look at, replacment parts are available. The batteries are a little tight to fit in the frame but that‚Äôs a good thing. Cons. It‚Äôs a little time-consuming to remove the body so I drilled a nice neat hole behind the back window and use a pencil & eraser to turn it on and off also If you‚Äôre in the dirt it‚Äôs easy to lose your pins other than that this is a wonderful RC car, very well thought out.

title: Cheap plastic that breaks easy
text:
You get what you pay for. This was an inexpensive way into fast rc cars. But the quality is cheap. Bought 2 of these on prime day but just opened on Christmas. Having a fast car made mostly of plastic doesn't yield it lasting long. At the speeds it goes you're gonna bump into stuff. The front upper arm broke within 15 minutes. On the other car I gave to my son his wheel came off within 10 minutes even though we tightened the bolts as recommended before using it. Fortunately found the bolt that held it on and avoided that problem. But then 10 minutes later the shell top cover cracked. So between 2 cars in less than 20 minutes total a upper arm broke, the shell broke, and a wheel came off.
Plus the remotes are finicky as to when they want to work. It will be going fine and then not work. This is all within our backyard which is 70 feet by 50 feet. Pairing the car & remote is easy... but keeping them paired, well...
Again, cheap product. Can't say I'm surprised based on the good price of this. Yet the first day of using it and I've already had to order almost $100 of replacement parts. You get what you pay for... buyer beware.

title: Super fast and fun
text: My son loves this. Just wish the batteries last longer.

title: Awesome Car!
text: Awesome vehicle on every surface!

title: Get what you pay for
text:
I like how fast it is but the battery doesn't last that long. Tonight i tried the 2 batteries in it together and it seamed much slower, the front wheels couldn't even pull off the ground on grass which is too easy to do with just the one battery. Also tonight the thing went nuts in full reverse for no reason at all ( absolutely no moisture at the time which is what i figured caused something like that a previous time) luckily it went into a bush and got stuck or it was going in the street. It also was over heating after 3 batteries but it is 93 f outside and it was in grass the whole time so i guess i can't really be too upset about that.
It is a blast to play with and i guess for the price it's worth it as long as it doesn't keep going nuts on its own

title: Internal Gears wore out
text: Had this RC truck for about a month and at first was running great--until it didn't. in less than a month, the car lost power and started making a loud noise every time i would press on the gas; the loud noise sounds like metal scratching together and i can only assume the gears inside the RC were worn down with wear-and-tear. was extremely happy with the purchase, but for the shelf life of this toy, at this price, definitely not worth the headache of the breakdown. son was not happy with this RC's durability at all. i can understand if my son was driving it off of cliffs or high ramps and all, but it was only used on flat dirt and asphalt--shouldn't have broken so easily.

title: Robust RC Car
text: This is the first RC car I've purchased in probably 20 years.  I'm amazed at how solidly built it is.  It really feels like a quality car, and is as fast as advertised.  I miss the old two stick remotes, but I got used to the wheel / trigger remote fairly quickly, and I like it much more than I thought I would.  Honestly, I don't have another car to compare, but for the price, I'm very happy about how it runs, how responsive it is, and how sturdy it feels.  My only complaint is that the instructions do not necessarily match everything, but the mismatched stuff is small.  For example, it states when charging a battery, the charger will have a green light, with red lights indicating charge level.  In actuality, the green light flashes when charging and is solid when fully charged.  I'm very happy with this purchase thus far.  It's been a lot of fun.

title: Anyone wanna race???
text: I've been having a lot of fun with this Legend R/C Truck. This thing will haul ass.

title: SO FAST
text: Bought this R/C Truck for my son's 16th birthday and it did not disappoint. Went together fast, charged fast and went fast over grass, rocks, dirt hills and more. Highly recommend.

title: Faster than i expected!
text: I ordered one of these for my children after they started playing with my Traxxas Stampede.  it was a little bit smaller than i thought, my Stampede has about an inch longer wheelbase and i expected it to be the same.  the single battery seems to last about 20-25 min of normal play.  not running full speed the whole time.  pretty durable so far, except one of the bottom shock spring holders fell out.  pretty maneuverable and responsive, straight line speed is very close to my Stampede, which is very impressive.  i havent tried 2 batteries at once due to it accidentally not coming with the 2nd battery.  To their credit, they responded to my inquiry within a couple hours and shipped a new battery(which i just received today) amazingly fast.  i received the truck on monday, and today is thursday and i have the 2nd battery in my hand.  great little truck for fun around the yard and impressive customer service, i'll likely get a 2nd one soon so the kids can race each other.

title: Wheels consistently break off
text: My 8yr old loves this. Unfortunately 3 wheels at the axel have busted off. At first I thought we had tightened the lug nut too much, because we kept loosing lug nuts. Now I'm not so sure. I think it's the weakest point on the car. We started putting thread lock on the shafts after the first wheel broke, then finger tighten the nuts. Still didn't seem to work. I contacted customer support, which did get back in touch with me. The said its "normal wear and tear ". So I'm now stuck buying wheels every month? I'll pass on this one. Too bad.

title: Great RC vehicle
text: Super-fast, easy to use and very tough. We liked this one so much that we purchased a second 1:10 vehicle. Highly recommended from our experience.

title: Best RTR truck in its class, period.  Buy it!!
text: Awesome RTR truck especially for the money.  It's fast whether on or off the pavement, excellent handling, and just a sheer blast to run.  Unboxing to running in 5 minutes.  Comes with 2 batteries which is nice and they can be stacked to double the run time.  The run time with 1 battery is about average 10-15 minutes tops.  The controller feels a little cheap but it gets the job done.  Battery charging takes a while too, so if you want to run a lot, invest in more batteries.  Overall I'd say this is the best bang for the buck in its segment and price range. Definitely get it.

I have since purchased a different vehicle from a local store that specializes in RC vehicles. The one I purchased is built much, much, heavier, is faster and the price difference was only $30.00 more...think twice

title: Fast, responsive, great range
text:
We got this for our 13 year olds birthday. He said it was the best present ever and has been taking it to parks to find different terrain to drive it on. It is very fast and sturdy and he hasn‚Äôt found a place where he can drive it out of its range. It is also surprisingly quiet.
It comes with 2 batteries which extends play.

title: Exceptional truck, fast and tough no doubt. Just not the charger
text: This is a really fast, responsive, and durable truck. Really fun even at 31...I'm really happy overall, the only thing I can't speak for is the charger. Yeah it came with 2 batteries and 2 chargers. One charger doesn't work so I am limited on run time, frustrating. 4 out of 5 for that

title: Great for exercising my dog
text:
The main reason I go this is to give my Boxer dog something to chase to tire him out. I wanted something that was fast but didn't want to spend the money on more expensive competitors. That way if it should break (or if he breaks it) I'm not too upset. I can buy two of these for the cost of one Traxxas or similar when you factor that you have to buy the batteries and charger separately.

Pros:
Comes with 2 batteries and an adapter so that you can use both batteries at once.
Batteries are fully enclosed inside the frame of the truck.
Seems durable and reliable.

Cons:
Advertised speed of 30 MPH is probably somewhat misleading. I do think it's probably somewhat slower than that.
My dog can catch it at full speed on grass. Perhaps it's faster on pavement, but I haven't tried. Boxers are relatively fast dogs, but definitely not the fastest out there. If you are buying it for the purpose of dog exercise, keep this in mind. Be sure to let your dog rest after 5 to 10 mins of continuous exercise, so they don't get injured.
Comes with a fire resistant battery pouch. Don't know whether this is a pro or a con, but our cell phones also use Li-Po batteries and they do not feel the need to supply a fire resistant pouch. Take from that what you will.

title: Very durable and gets looks!
text:
So far so good!! Love the craftsmanship of the car. It's also extremely durable. My cousin's ran it into a couple of actual cars (parked) and no problem. The battery life is crazy long. Car comes with 2!! Not sure if a beginner should own a car this quick though. My only concern.

Wish it was a life size model for me!!

title: Excellent value for the price!
text:
So far we love this truck! I waited a week before writing a review to give it some time and see how well it worked. I read reviews for probably 2 months on various models before picking this one.

So far this truck has held up great! It's very fast and will both batteries we average around 25 minutes of use. Each battery takes around 2 1/2 hours to charge.

The dual speed option on the remote is a huge positive as my kid is getting used to it. Also love that it came with full assembly instructions and part numbers everything which are easy to find on Amazon as well.

One note to mention is that if you are driving through lots of grass you need to keep the cooling vents for the motors cleaned out after each use.
I just take a shop vac to them. Then blow it off with some air, wipe it down with some mild degreaser and crc contact cleaner then add some wd40 to axle joints. Maybe it's overkill but I want to make sure it last a long time.

title: Awesome truck - but jumping ship
text:
[[VIDEOID:da1a1c9ac8cfc8449b4819fa183c323e]] Update to my review below.
After more damage and more overpriced parts, I'm jumping to Traxxas. After a little research, their parts are MUCH more appropriately priced - and available everywhere. Laegendary doesn't have anything on their parts page under $10 (even tiny screws, which would be pennies apiece). Running this car has been a blast for my son, and it's sad to just ditch it, but the nickel-and-diming from the company (eg, not even including the necessary parts for repair - everything is separate and overpriced) has been overwhelming and draining. Time to go.

I‚Äôm torn on this mixed review. Here are my honest experiences since buying this for my 7-year-old in November (3 months in so far.)

TLDR: Awesome car. Steep learning curve. Be prepared. I was not.

He had his heart set on an X-Maxx like he sees on YouTube. Very much not in our price range. But we wanted to go up a notch since experiencing his first car, the Deere RC in the $50 range (awesome little car, very durable and runs great, but got very hard to steer.) After much research, this Legend seemed very cool, and a great step up.

It is the first car like this we‚Äôve owned, and I wasn‚Äôt clear on the ride we were in for.

The car itself is really amazing and super fun. Our son LOVES it. It‚Äôs fast and easy to control. The steering trim and radius adjustments are fantastic. The High and Low speeds are great.

Honestly, it‚Äôs a little beast, and can take quite a beating. Our kid doesn‚Äôt know the word ‚Äúsubtle,‚Äù and he runs it hard. Jumps are his thing, along with donuts, spin-outs‚Ä¶whatever makes it fun.

Again ‚Äì first car like this I‚Äôve owned, and even the fact that the top shell is removable came as a surprise, let alone the fact that it has a complete replaceable parts breakdown. Cool, I thought, but wasn‚Äôt sure if we‚Äôd ever actually get into that.

Man, was I wrong.

3 months in, we‚Äôve already spent more than the original price of the car in parts. None of them are that expensive‚Ä¶ but bit by bit, over time, they sure add up.

The shell cotter pins come off VERY easily. We now run with only 2 or 3 to prevent excessive loss. I found a couple at a local hardware store, but wound up buying a set of the originals.

After seeing how long the battery lasts, I wound up getting 3 more. We always run with a double set and have 2 on the chargers.

We busted a front shock on the first day. I now have 3 spares.

The front bumper is only attached at 2 places. I‚Äôve been very disappointed at that, being the part that takes the main impact. It came off after about a month.

The arm connecter (the metal plate on the under-side front) broke, finally rendering it undrivable. It took a month for the part to come, and when it did, it came without screws. Those apparently are a separate part for which they charge $1 per incredibly tiny screw. I spent hours trying to find them online, and came close with a machine company who sold virtually the same one for $.11/screw, but the thread was wrong, so I‚Äôm waiting for the OEM to arrive.

After 2.5 months, my son noticed an unusual noise that we couldn‚Äôt diagnose. We took video and sent it to the company who suggested that we "replace the differentials." As if that‚Äôs just something that people do. They arrived quickly, and I slowly learned - as I waded into repair - that this was a full tear-down. Be sure to label your screws!! I found a video on YouTube that was much more helpful than the Legend tutorial. We also had to run out to get grease from Pepboys since none comes with the parts. Apparently, half of the rear drive gear was stripped ‚Äì and we‚Äôre still not sure why.

After finally getting the car fully rebuilt and back to ‚Äúnew,‚Äù including bumpers and new LED wiring harness, it was great to run it again.

Then the rear light wires broke ‚Äì again ‚Äì on the first run. Just today. So back to the online shop we go.

Overall, the company has been helpful and responsive. I‚Äôve reached out with my frustration of the experience.

I realize (learning!) that playing hard has consequences, and thankful that we CAN do repairs. I half-want to tell my son to "run it easier," but that's no fun, and not what it's for. I get that.

I do wish that some parts were built better, like the front bumper and the wiring harness. I wish they had a better solution for the shell pins ‚Äì they come off way too easily, and I wish there was more of a quick-release way to remove the shell to change the batteries and access power. While most parts are priced well, some are extremely overpriced. I wish screws were included with essential replacement parts, and that grease came with gears. Things like that.

And, obviously, be prepared and comfortable to take stuff apart and put it back together. I am, but not everybody is.

I didn‚Äôt know any of this when I bought the RC. I wish I did. Now you do. I hope it‚Äôs helpful. Buy this awesome little car. Be prepared, and have fun!

title: BEST RC EXPERIENCE!
text: The next day after the car arrived I used it and it responded greatly. The car endured bumpy roads, rainy weather, puddles and dirt. There were times when I thought the car was going to break, but it was more resistant than I thought. The battery life is excellent, with a proper handling and the use of the low transmition setting, I reached more than 1 hour of racing. Eventhough the car was a bit smaller than I expected, and that the transmitter could be made with better materials, the car was simply AWESOME.

title: Extremely Fun And Easy to Drive
text: This car flies and is quite durable. I did find out its not indestructible, but customer service is fantastic. Initially I had the LED lights plugged in backwards and customer service was willing to send out a new set of lights had I not determined my mistake. After the 4th day of driving, the rear axle stopped engaging. Disassembly isn't difficult, and the included instruction manual has a nice diagram of all the screws that need to be removed to access the rear gearbox. I tried tightening the gearbox to see if that would fix the problem, but it persisted. Customer service sent out a new gear box immediately. I'm going to look into upgrading the battery because something as fun as this should last longer than 30 minutes!! Having the setting for learning speed is really helpful for allowing my kids to drive it without damaging all the trees in my yard.

title: Greatest RC Truck of all time!
text:
My brother bought this RC truck for my three sons, and it might just be the greatest RC vehicle of all time! The controls are silky smooth and uber-responsive, and this thing has all wheel drive so it shreds concrete, grass, and dirt! The wheels are air-filled rubber (not solid) so grip and traction are top notch. This beast will pop a wheelie if you punch it!

All three of my boys (11, 9, and 7) got the hang of the controls very quickly and were able to run this thing through its paces with ease. There are two speed modes (low and high) so you can dial it back for the little ones. I started my 7 year old on the low speed, but he kicked it up into high after about 5 minutes and never looked back. Most importantly, this thing is super durable! Despite my almost constant coaching/pleading, my boys crashed this thing into a variety of obstacles (mailboxes, sprinkler valves, planters, trees, and curbs to name a few), and I'm happy to say that it has taken all the abuse like a champ. The body has some scuffs and scratches, but we're just chalking that up to war paint :)

This is an amazing RC vehicle for ALL AGES! I plan on driving this thing more than my boys will.

title: So fun! Easy enough for a 9-year-old with a little practice.
text: This truck is so much fun! I bought it for my 9-year-old nephew and now I want one for myself. I figured, correctly, that the speed would be a bit hard for him, as a beginner, to handle. I made sure that he used it in a big, open area where he couldn‚Äôt crash into anything until he got the hang of it. It didn‚Äôt take long for him to get a feel for it. While this isn‚Äôt really classified as a child‚Äôs toy, it can be used by older children with a little care and practice. That being said, he‚Äôs run the truck over curbs, through dirt and grass, over uneven, rocky terrain, you name it. This truck can handle whatever we throw at it. It‚Äôs crazy fast, incredibly stable, and a blast to drive! There was one incident where the steering stopped responding but somehow it corrected itself. I wasn‚Äôt with him at the time but from what he and his dad described it sounds like there was perhaps a communication error between the car and the remote. Whatever the problem was, nothing was broken and the car worked perfectly again the next day. It‚Äôs been about two weeks and aside from dirt and a few scratches, the truck works just as well as the day it arrived. I don‚Äôt have anything to compare this to but I would highly recommend this truck for anyone except maybe inexperienced kids younger than about 8 or so. And for kids it‚Äôs probably best to keep the speed on the low setting. Still plenty fast!

title: MOST BANG FOR YOUR BUCK!
text: I had been wanting an RC truck for years, but never wanted to spend the money on one of the big name hobby models. I saw this model had outstanding reviews, and had everything I needed to start. Most of the hobby models are $300+, and don't include batteries or a controller. This model is perfect for getting into RC cars. It was all the replacement parts you need in case you break something. For $160 you won't find a better set. Its definitely more durable than I expected it to be. I figured it would be easy to break at this price point. I was wrong. I crashed it several times my first time out with it. I crashed into a break wall at full speed and it just kept going. I banged it up pretty good and it never affected its performance. Its also pretty easy to control, my 2 year old was starting to get the hang of the controls after about 5 minutes. If you want to get into RC trucks this is 100% the best product to get. Its a lot of fun! My wife also enjoyed playing with it as well.

title: Loctite the Wheels!
text:
I bought this product for my 9 and 11 year old boys. They got one each. In reading the instructions it said to tighten the wheels before each use. I did it for one of the trucks but forgot it for the other. Lo and behold, the one I forgot to tighten had its right front wheel came off and I lost one of the hub assembly parts when the wheel came off. This hub assembly has a cross bar that runs through the drive shaft allowing for the hub assembly to be secure in one place rather than rotating freely. I had to get a small finishing nail with the right diameter to replace that small part and to make sure the hub assembly does not spin freely.

I would advise people that the first thing they should do is but a drip of loctite (or nail polish in a pinch) on those wheel nuts (the thread on the drive shaft to be specific) to make sure the nut does not fall off. I would not say it's a faulty design since proportionately to its size and weight, these trucks generate a lot of torque and spinning rotation that the nuts will come lose no matter what.

The package also came with an adapter that allows two batteries to be connected to the truck at the same time, extending its running time. The adapter on one of the truck was not working. It's not a big deal since I've been running the trucks with just one battery at a time then replacing the batter as they run down. These adapters are not cheap at $10 each but I bought extras anyway since I have two additional spare batteries for each truck extending the kids' driving time to around 1 1/2 hours. Which brings me to that batteries.

Each battery packet will run the truck around 20 minutes on low power mode with hard driving (the only way a 9 or 11 year old knows how to drive). The truck comes with two battery packets. I bought an extra set of two batteries for each truck which got expensive but at least it lasts long enough that the kids are satisfied with the driving time.

Mechanically I have not run into any problems so far. The kids run the trucks pretty hard and have been bashing objects or even roadside curbs when they get out of control. I am expecting something to break soon just out of normal wear and tear. Good news is Legendary pretty much sells every part in the truck if something breaks.

I've read from others that this is not really a 1/10 scale but more a 1/16. But for first time RC owners in my kids, it's plenty big enough and surprisingly durable. Granted they received this as a Christmas gift so it's not even one month yet as I write this review. I am happy with the product in general but you have to have the right expectations. Proportionately, this thing puts loads of mechanical stress on the parts. If you drive your car/truck like this I'm sure it will break something soon enough. With that said, I think it is a good product.

title: Can take a beating and a half.
text: Great truck to get a new guy into rc trucks! Speed is right around 30mph. Controls are easy to learn. Battery life is definitely not 40 minutes, more like 15 on high speed mode. Had it for a few days now and used extensively, hahaha. Took it on a jump today it landed wrong and blew out a shock and the part where it connects to the front lower arm. What I think happened is that since the truck landed mostly on one tire it maxed out the shock and spring and the force from the landing then transfered into the little plastic stub on the side of the front lower arm and blew that out as well. Factory shocks that this thing comes with aren't the worst but they aren't the best either. As soon as you can upgrade to metal shocks that are taller and have a higher spring rate. From my research on hosimrc.com there are plastic replacement parts but there are no aluminium parts to be found anywhere on any rc store for the 9125. Save yourself my trouble and UPGRADE YOUR SHOCKS AND SPRINGS!! Overall super freaking fun to drive and pretty durable despite my terrible landing, hahaha.

title: Good car for the price
text:
Ever since I was little I always wanted a big kids RC car. Finally decided to treat myself for Christmas. I didn't want to break the bank so I found this and with all the great reviews I figured it would be a good starting car. Very happy with the car's performance and I even let both my kids, 7 and 10 years old, try it on the slower speed setting. They got the knack for it pretty quick. Overall very happy with the purchase.

Update: Doing a little bit more research I have come to the conclusion that this isn't a true 1/10 scale. It's more a 1/12. Finding bodies that are said to be 1/10 are around 2" to 3" longer than the body on this and at least 1 1/2" to 2" wider. The dimensions for 1/12 scale bodies are much closer to this one. Kind of a disappointment, but the truck is still fun.

Found soyee 1:10 RTR High Speed 46km/h RC Car 4WD 2.4GHz Remote Control Monster Truck All Terrain Hobby Grade Off-Road For $120 same setup and everything I paid extra to have a missing spring clip which I‚Äôm going to order to complete truck

title: Great for beginning RC drivers!
text: So, here it is. I originally bought one of these cars for my 12 year old. A week later, a second car arrived for me! This little thing is pretty cool, and for the price, it is a great entry level car. There are a couple of drawbacks, though. 1) the front bumper is pretty weak. It cracked then totally broke within the first week on my son's car, and the first day on my car. We got a replacement bumper (in three days from Laegendary) and it seems to be holding up really well; better than the original bumper. Overall, we really like these cars. Like I said, a great entry level car that is above the toy standard, but below the "customizable" cars that go for twice the price.

title: Great RC for beginners
text:
This RC car is great! I have no experience with RCs up until this point and didn‚Äôt want to spend 300+ on some of the bigger name brands. So far it has held up to driving pretty aggressively, as in: taking it off 4 foot jumps sometimes landing on side and back, lots of wheelies and going full speed through deep grass, gravel, and dirt, hitting puddles that were way deeper than expected, and climbing logs and rocks and plywood ramps. I am not nice to it.
Also, there is something of an aftermarket world for it. It‚Äôs basically a Hosim 9125. I have added 12mm hub spacers, larger Super Swamper tires, dual 2k batteries, a 9125 front bumper spacer (important to have IMO) and I painted the shell green.
It‚Äôs a fun RC that you can beat on and not worry if something breaks.

title: Fun to drive. Missing a few features. Still recommend.
text: Great car. A lot of fun. Great speed. Great torque. Rough and tumble. Just has a couple features missing: comes with the ability to double up the batteries for more power, but these do not fit inside the battery enclosure; battery enclosure is a little tight even for one battery. Access to on/off power switch and access to battery enclosure is blocked by cover and requires removing of small chassis body clip pins. At one point, this listing advertised 100 extra pins, but those are trapped behind a survey and a month-long wait.

title: Parts not durable!

title: Decent truck for the money
text: Durable enough for my needs.  I've driven it down the stairs in the house and outside multiple times at different speeds...  It's taken about a 3-4 foot jump while landing mostly on the nose and front wheels without any breaks.  I drove it through snow about 3 inches deep on multiple occasions and it was quite soaked each time.  It didn't stop working at the time but after a few cycles of this poor treatment the power switch seized in the off position.  My trying to force it on broke it.  It's not water proof nor did it appear to be but I was having fun.  Fortunately, they had provided an extra switch in my box and about an hour later with a screw driver, I was back up and running.  Although I have beat it up a bit I've tried to avoid high-speed crashes and particularly avoiding hard frontal hits directly on a wheels.  I suspect it would break.  Fortunately, the parts are easy to find on Amazon.  Look for Hosim 9125.  I had purchased another different car as well (https://www.amazon.com/gp/product/B07G48VDW5) that was little cheaper that didn't perform as well or have even close to the durability or part availability.  Be sure to check for part availability on whatever you get.  Overall I'm pretty happy with this car and ordered a couple more for the family and extra parts.

title: Part broke in first 30 minutes of use on Christmas morning
text: Within the first 30 minutes of use, the rear axle broke where it meets the wheel. I noticed that it‚Äôs a cheap flimsy plastic piece, where most of the other parts are metal. Why would they design the part holding the ball joint at the end of the axle to be plastic?? Car started out really fun. Goes fast and handles off road terrain relatively well. Hoping Laegendary will send me a replacement part, car, or refund so I can update my review positively.

title: Great bargain for what you get.
text: I got 2 of these for boys 6 and 9. The 2 speed selection was great for allowing the younger one to learn and fast enough for the older boy to be excited. These seem like a great start to get into the RC world at a reasonable price and I'm not sure you get a lot more performance out of the cars that are 5-10x the price aside from maybe more durable parts? These have been run into curbs and trees and misc stationary objects at full speed with no issue yet. Battery life is as expected, the extra battery makes them plenty enjoyable. I would highly recommend.

title: Excellent RC truck
text: Truck was ready to go out of the box. Easy to use and kids have had a ton of fun with it so far.

title: Fast, durable, springy, and shocky. This is the best!
text:
Our son got this for his birthday this year, and he couldn't be happier. It's easy to attach the lights and hook everything up. And the car is zippy! Man it's fast and durable, and it seems like the batteries have been lasting longer than the 25 minutes that they advertise. We've have a blast playing with it this week, and we imagine that we have many hours of fun ahead of us this summer!

A couple of things: the remote control was a little wonky at first so we had to turn it off and turn it back on, then we had no issues after that. Also, the power button is under the truck cover, which makes sense, I suppose (we're new to RC cars) but can take a little extra time when we're chomping at the bit to get out and play!

Overall, this is great, and I'd recommend this company to others who are looking for a high quality, fun RC car. So amazing--I might ask for one for my birthday as well :).

Thanks Laegendary!

title: On time delivery
text: Great entertainment

title: Good quality
text: HAPPY with the purchase. Good quality for the money. Easy to operate. Fun RC vehicle.

title: Awesome
text:
Great, fun little RC car. I‚Äôve got plenty of things I enjoy about the vehicle, and a couple things I dislike, or wish would‚Äôve been done differently. So...

The small dislikes are the size of the vehicle, and the front ‚Äúbumper‚Äù guard where the headlights rest. The guard snapped really quickly ‚Äî after first use with some beating on the vehicle. I‚Äôve driven cars in the past that I‚Äôve put through the absolute worst and nothing but scratches or a couple nicks were left to show the abuse. That‚Äôs what we buy these trucks for. Shred terrain without have to worry about breaking cars. The second dislike is how small it is compared to other 1:10 trucks in its class. Compared to my sons 1:10 truck this thing is small.

But that‚Äôs about it for gripes. They can be seen as personal dislikes and I‚Äôm not one to take stats away for that. It‚Äôs not an issue with functionality and it‚Äôs not fair to the retailer to deduct points for. Why? Well.... for starters:

The truck looks as advertised and does every bit as it‚Äôs advertised to. It‚Äôs fast as hell and has nice response time to trigger pull. It shines in driveway, yard, gravel and sand spots. Just ripping it through dirt and debris, drifting it around the yard, or giving it some cliffs to jump off really make for a fun time. It comes with two batteries that can run simultaneously. A tool to tinker with the truck. Nice packaging. But most importantly, it comes with a manual for beginners that really pinpoints how to adjust the remote control to put your truck on the straight and narrow.

This vehicle is awesome. I wouldn‚Äôt let my kids play with it, because even at ~30 mph it‚Äôs too much vehicle for them. I grew up around fast RCs, but they were more common then. Now it‚Äôs hard to find anyone who enjoys it, and radio shack doesn‚Äôt exist anymore so RCs get out on the back burner anymore.

Anyway, I digress. Do yourself a favor, before purchasing a $500 60mph+ brushless or methane remote car, purchase this little baby and at least get your feet wet. It does what you need. Drives smooth. Responsive and clean looking. Enjoy adult hood without tearing up your wallet.

title: great product
text: great quality.  well built and will provide a lot of fun for the entire family!  Highly recommend this product.

title: Decent for the $$$, not true 1:10 scale, and won't go 30MPH
text:
I bought this while it was on sale for $125. I would say overall it is a decent product for the price since it comes with everything you need to run(batteries, chargers, etc.). It is not true 1:10 scale though, not even close as you can see in the photo next to my Revo 1:10. I would also like to point out that one of the batteries already has run time issues as it only last about half of the time and the unit is only 2 and a half weeks old. In addition to this, its tops out at 22MPH at best and it's advertised at 30MPH.

Side note...when I received the unit, there was a card for 100 free pins. I filled everything out and reviewed the product and have not received any confirmation via email or pins in the mail. We shall see.

Pros:
- Decent build for the money
- Comes with everything you need right out of the box
- Lights

Cons
- Not true 1:10 scale
- Battery life deteriorates quickly
- Won't go advertised 30MPH

I will update on the longevity of the car at a later point in time as it is too soon to tell. Would have given 3.5 stars if there was an option.

title: Absolutely perfect! Fast and rugged!
text: [[VIDEOID:36c82c73e2b7bb8274a8e3299e3dcf4b]] This car is more than expected. It is fast,  runs through anything and while the tires grip well too Gerry through grass and dirt, they slide enough in pavement to allow the car to drift and spin out.  Tons of torque and a lot of fun. Batteries run out within 15- 20 minutes for each one,  then take a good deal of time to recharge. That may be the only negative. That's expected as the battery packs are small and light. Great product! Thank you!

title: It's great for beginners, no bashing and inspect motor bay for debris so you could hours of fun!
text:
[[VIDEOID:c800277ef046d5981531e12632fb7b8d]] This is our first 1:10 RC truck. Giving it 5 stars after using it a few times. Great for beginners and the time quoted is good 25-30 mins of play time. One battery gave my son 30mins on low speed gentle runs about the yard. Tearing around the beach and dirt tracks gave him about 25mins using the two batteries. Was unable to install the two batteries in the car - battery dock too small.
Oh just make sure you clean it out after tearing up the dirt track or beach. Check the added photo of sand in the motor bay. Tear down diagram was helpful. Will buy another one to race him :)
*We didn't use it for bashing - just flat high speed runs with a few jumps not more than 6" high. Yes a few cartwheels happened, wheel came off during a doughnut but found the wheel nut - phew! Could do with 2 extras in the box.
Will try a slightly larger battery amp size for longer run times soon.

After sending the review above, I decided to revisit the double loading of batteries. It's possible - just take your time and be careful with the wires.

title: Not bad
text: [[VIDEOID:77ec353f6aa2b43528c7a19be8e01677]] Not a bad truck. I bought two of them. The control arms bearings and steering components all have lots of play right out of the box. title: Truck is an Unbelievable Value!!!
text:
The legend RD car is probably the best deal you will find out there!
Highly recommended for beginner or youth groups, this RC does not disappoint!
It is 100% waterproof! You can basically drive this thing into water with full confidence that it will just keep going.
By far this thing trumps any other RC from within the price range.
The only weakness I could find lies within the batteries and the various charging methods.
If you want to run this as your primary RC and get the most use out of it, an alternate charging method is recommended.
They take 1400Mah LiPo batteries that have universal connectors, so charging them directly from the wall with the included USB is advised.
If you buy a separate LiPo charger, you will optimize this RC to the point where this thing is perfection!
I would recommend this RC to anyone who wants a superb deal and a ridiculous value.

title: Better Than Hoped For!
text:
My son wanted a Traxxas RC car for Christmas, because he was watching the guys from Dude Perfect drive them around, but when I saw the price of a Traxxas, I decided to look for other options, and I'm glad I did! I was worried that my 10 year old might be a little disappointed that he didn't get the official Traxxas car, but he has stated over and over that he is so glad that he has a Laegendary!
Right out of the box it was simple to get going and he has been ripping it up ever since! It is super fast, does donuts easily in dirt, gravel, grass, or just about anywhere. He loves doing jumps on hills he has created, or ramps he has made. It is easy to control and can take a beating, as he's run it into plenty of trees already!
I'm 39 years old and I have never had an RC car so cool! I highly recommend, and don't see why anyone would be disappointed!

title: Good Truck
text:
I'm impressed with this truck, it's fast! Couple issues, though. First the charger quit working after the first charge cycle of the battery. It wouldn't power the charger up. Fortunately, it started working some time later, I think maybe the power supply was too hot. Doesn't give me confidence that it will last long, though. Also, after about the 4th run of the truck, one of the wheels fell off! Luckily it appeared that just the nut loosened up which caused the spill and we were able to find the nut and put it back together. After that I went through and made sure to tighten all the nuts to make sure those were tight too. Interesting, considering they're nylon locking nuts.

Other than that, my kid loves it and we're having a lot of fun with it. Seems solid for the money.

title: Parts break - not worth headache or money
text: Runs good but after one day or driving - Front Shaft broke (poor design inside wheel), Shock broke (cheap plastic at body attachments) - expect these parts to break very often. Replacements cost $15-18 (sold in pairs). Locknuts loosen very easily - expect to loose these ($10 set of 4). 1600mAh battery only lasts about 15 min if you are lucky and that is on beginner speed - a 5200mAh will cost about $30.  For the constant repairing this vehicle will need I do not recommend this car at all. These parts should not break so easily. Not fun for anyone (kid/parent) having to deal with these issues.

title: This is the one to buy!!!
text: I don't normally leave reviews for product, but I have to make an exception for this one. This RC truck is so much fun to use!!! The seller reached out to me a couple days after the product arrived to make sure all was good. The only issue I had was that the AC charger was missing from the box. They immediately shipped me one and we were up and running. I would give their customer service 10 stars if I could. This is a great company that is really going above and beyond to provide their customers with a great experience. The truck itself is well made and durable. I've let my daughter's play with it for long periods of time. They've wrecked it pretty hard on multiple occasions and the thing just keeps on keeping on!!! I wasn't too concerned about them breaking it since it wasn't very expensive, but all in all, it's been an amazing toy/experience to purchase this that I would highly recommend it to anyone on the fence about buying one. Now that my wife and I are fighting over this one, I'm going to have to buy another one!!

title: A truck that's fun to drive
text:
First the bad part, I did not receive a cable to connect two batteries together as advertised. However we seem to get about 30 minutes of fun time on one battery and can switch to the included second battery easily. The car does go quite fast and has good traction for obstacles. It is fun to drive on a race track. It does flip over on its back side easily and you can't use another car to flip you over like though can with other cars, but as we become better drivers that don't matter as much.
The slow speed is helpful for driving on an obstacle course but a bit slower should have been better. The charger and remote work great, all in all a great car with a great price.

title: Poor quality
text: The vehicles are fast and initially was very happy. We purchased 4 of them, spending over $700. They DO NOT LAST AND ARE POOR QUALITY. The rear differentials go out about every 4th or 5th time using them. I reached out to Leagendary and they refered me to Amazon to buy more parts, they DO NOT stand behind thier product. Then dig out the battery, find the cord and plug it into a USB port and wait. Then, reassemble. Not easy or fun. If the truck could be plugged in while keeping the parts together then I would have kept it. Returned immediately.
