title: Exactly what I was looking for in my third RC car.
text: I bought this for my son's 11th birthday. He's had two other fairly simple RC cars and was ready for something much more serious. As usual, I wanted to balance value and fun. Laegendary's 1:10 scale car has been perfect. It was so fast that crashes were frequent at first. Fortunately, the car is very sturdy and has two speeds. Within a day or two, he was much better and started taking jumps at full speed and doing tricks. The car has really has held up well under constant use for over a month and shows no signs of slowing down. It takes some time to change batteries (the only reason my son could think of for taking one star away from the rating). It does help to have an air compressor handy when running through very dusty ground, which we have plenty of here in the desert. Finally, and this was very important to me, any replacement parts are easily obtained from Amazon, but I don't anticipate that anytime soon.

title: Ready to run!!!
text: I bought this for my 8yr old son and was a big hit. I‚Äôve grown up with all the bad ass high-end cars from hobby shops. This ready to run car is very simple and extremely impressive for this price point. I would highly recommend this RC car for first time drivers and parents who want to flashback to their youth. Christmas is coming and we may have to get a second one so we can have some family battles.

title: Could be improved a bit but really great RC Truck!!
text: Great RC Truck my son loves it!! It‚Äôs great that it can be upgraded to be more durable. The leds are super bright so great at night. The controller also has a pretty long range. Only 3 complaints I really have are the battery life, no switch for led lights, and the dual battery feature. The battery life is pretty short so not as much run time as we would like and takes to long to charge the batteries. The led lights are great for night but there‚Äôs no switch to turn them off during the day, so it just drains the battery while you drive during the day. Also it would be great if there was a battery cover built for the dual battery feature instead of a strap so dust and dirt didn‚Äôt get in the compartment. But overall pretty fast and fun!!

title: Great RC
text: This RC is a great value for the price!

title: SO MUCH FUN!
text: This RC truck is amazing! My 7 year old could not believe how quick and responsive it is, and we followed the (very good) advice to begin at low speed! We started on a flat surface as instructed, the excitement continued to grow with the first battery.  We couldn‚Äôt wait to get it on hills and gravel and this truck never gives up. We are used to the cheaper RC vehicles, and this is a huge step up. The battery lasts over the 30 minutes advertised, but it will never be enough. The body is thin plastic and cracked early and we have already lost the first body clip pin. The extra pins included are much appreciated. It will be a while before we try the high speed setting because we have a lot of fun learning ahead! This truck is a great performer and exceeded my high expectations!

title: Great little car but it did have some problems.
text: The Car was as advertised, but there were problems. Received the car and read the instructions. We charged the 2 batteries and on the second battery the front wheel fell off. Prior to running the car we checked all of the nuts on each wheel before operating. When the wheel fell off the spacer and pin on the backside fell off and the pin was no where to be found. Fortunately I had ordered a small kit with extra parts for something like this. The second day of use the steering started acting up and would only turn to one side. This worked itself out but then the transmission locked up. So we did a return label for this car and took a a chance and ordered another car. We have not received our credit on the first one yet but I assume we will. The second car has been spot on with no problems so far. I would recommend a few things. When running the car at least one time during each battery that you run the car, stop and check the nuts on the wheels as they do get loose especially if you are doing donuts. I know they say you can run them in water but I would recommend not too. We only ran it through one small puddle one time but that seemed to be when the steering started having problems and the transmission acted up. So far the second car has been great. I have a 10 year old and it is perfect for him.

title: Is as advertised
text: This my first purchase of an RC car of this kind, as I am a novice. I highly recommend this newbies and experts alike, for the price I don't think you can beat it. If you are a novice like me, I highly recommend getting replacement parts, I did dislocate the back rear shock, which just snapped back into place. but I am sure Ill end up breaking something on it......and it IS very VERY quick, I live on 30 mpg road, and it was going slightly faster than the cars I was racing. It seems to have decent range. The only thing I don't like, is that it seems to have a slight issue going into reverse at times, not sure if its me, or the truck. However, I would definitely purchase again!!

title: Tuff, fun, RC truck
text: This thing takes jumps with ease. The six oil filled shocks just absorb what ever you throw at it. Handles full throttle turns. Fun and quick to top speed. It‚Äôs 2-390 brushed motors + 60a ESC give it good punch and plenty of torque. Metal front and rear chassis protection for extra durability. Metal center drive line, drive shafts, diffs and diff cups. 2 lipo batteries good for 15-20 minute run time each. Battery box is easy to open and fits both batteries if you want to run them parallel. Comes with a parallel adapter, lipo balance charger, extra body pins and a small wheel nut wrench.

title: Fast and fun
text: The RC truck is nice, very fast, awesome suspension. 4 shocks in rear and 2 in front. All oil filled. üëç The battery life seems low. I timed them at full throttle non stop and got 20 minutes out of it....not too bad but this was not enough time for the second battery to fully charge. Full charge on battery is almost 1 hour and so kids were kinda bummed about that since they don't have much patience.  The truck has awesome speed, you can drift all 20 min with that 4x4. LED lights are bright for night use...this is the first RC I've owned with lights...I thought that was a cool feature. One small issue I noticed was that at times when I turned the unit, the truck would drive on it's own and do crazy flips and just run into anything....no sure if there was a radio frequency interference or what but the kids got a kick out of it. My kids were set on the TRAXXAS brand but those were way out of my price range since I had to purchase 2 trucks for my boys. Overall I'm satisfied and for the money,  you wont get a 4x4 and or LED lights for this price. Great buy.

title: One Happy Customer
text: This is my first 4wd RC and I'm so glad I ordered this one - it's fast and solid.

title: Great Truck for the Money
text:
I have been out of the RC car game for years (Tamiya Blackfoot and Kyosha Ultima days). I wanted something me and my daughter could putt around with. This truck is really well made. The old shocks were a nice surprise and it soaks up bumps pretty well. Frame is solid and it actually has metal skid plates under both hubs. The High and Low speeds are nice as in High is can get wild in a hurry. Any technical driving I needed to keep it in low. Other than ripping in a straight line the High is way fast, too fast for my reflexes. I understand there are faster trucks out there, but at this price point it is hard to beat and I am not sure I can handle going much faster without destroying the truck or my neighbors property. Controller also seems to be solid, but keep in mind this is not a Futaba nor are you paying a Futaba price. They also seem to have some parts availability which was important to me, though some are on backorder including the body.

The only bad things I can think of is the body pins get lost quick. Putting some rubber ring washers under the body at each of the mount points would probably help. Probably also my fault as I have a bit of road rash on the body after a couple batteries lol. Also while listed at 1/10 this is a tad smaller than that scale.

Highly recommended, and the seller seems to care about their customer.

title: Best all-in-one starter RC kit
text: Bought one for my son who has little to no experience with RC cars, and it works great by letting him get the hang of it in low mode and then he can switch to high mode for a little more intense action. This thing is fast in high mode, and is well built. Between myself and my son, we have rolled it, jumped it, flipped it and it just keeps going. So far we have only scratched up the body and lost one body pin. One caveat is that there seems to be a slight hesitation occasionally from the controller to the unit, but it is hard to reproduce every time. Going to buy another one for my youngest son.

title: Fast Shipping
text: The product was neatly packed and well protected. The R/C truck was as advertised and a blast to race around. Shipping was faster than I hoped for, considering it was just a couple weeks before Christmas when I placed the order. And the shipper was kind enough to follow up on the purchase to make sure we received everything in working condition. Overall, it has been a positive experience from a customer's point of view and can think of no cons at all. I look forward to many fun hours of racing... And perhaps a few hours tormenting and chasing the cats, lol.

title: I bought two, both broke by day 3.
text: Absolute junk. Today is Wednesday, my boys got these on Monday and both are broken. They raced them around a clear clean back yard. No jumps, no rocks, nothing but grass. The first one has a major structural fault. The weld that causes a tire to spin broke, so that‚Äôs done. On the other one the bolt holding the tire on flew off while racing around the yard and the tire just fell off. The screw is somewhere in the backyard. Since my other car is useless we took a screw off of it. One of them does not go straight and never did. It always turned left.  Awful, I would send this junk back in a heartbeat. So much for their super awesome birthday gift. One star is the lowest I could go.

title: super fun and fast!
text: The moment we received our RC car, my 11 year old son took it for a drive and we were blown away!  This car is super fast and super fun!  The dual batteries certainly extends the fun and we truly get about 30 min of run time.  The car is very agile and can do lots of tricks and jumps.  One of the minor issues we've noticed is that it is easy to lose the pins that keep the shell on the chassis.  Also, we've already broken off the front bumper and broke the front upper arm axle within the first three days.  Planning on contacting the company for some replacement parts.  Overall a lot of fun but not too durable.

title: Steering failed on two of these RC Trucks
text: I purchased two of these RC trucks and the steering mechanisms in both RCs failed!! One couldn't trun left anymore and the other couldnt turn at all. I took one of the RCs apart and tested the steering mechanism box. It would not swivel the full length in one of the directions the mechanism is a Chinese part with no number or identification code so I can't even order a replacement. My and my son loved the RC trucks when they worked. The first truck lasted about 2 months before steering failed. The second newly purchased truck only lasted about 2 weeks before the steering component failed. These cost too freaking much for cheap Chinese parts to be used that fail easily. $189.00 for only two weeks of use is BS. And I bought two of these RCs.

title: Poor Quality Parts
text:
So we had the car for only a few weeks and my son enjoyed driving it around in the backyard. One day he tries to drive it and it won't steer at all. Laegendary was very good about getting back to us and diagnosed it as a broken servo. Of course that isn't covered by the warranty. They also noted in their email "Because of the torque of the car, this part can break even after 5 mins of playtime." That is a direct quote where they basically admit the components of the car are not sufficient. For a $180 car I am beyond disappointed. I now have to buy a new servo through them and I'm sure that will be expensive. I am going to forward their email to Amazon to show they are admitting the materials used to build the car are poor quality. Buyer beware.

Update: I've increased my rating to 3 stars on this. Laegendary has replied they are going to send me a replacement servo. Once I get it they'll get another upgrade. Good customer service goes a long way with me.

title: Great hobby!! You pay for...
text:
I love the design and how fast the car goes. It says 50+Km an hour. It goes around 40-50mph!! Definitely fast for a little truck.

FOR NEW PEOPLE TO RC
Cars/trucks parts break and you'll definitely want a faster charger and extra batteries. Like I purchased. And dont buy parts off of amazon especially shafts for this model. Useless.....
I spent in total about $140 extra and parts and stuff to make the car last to my liking.
Batterys on the website are expensive but if you're a beginner you can always order a bigger size batterys with a better cc off amazon and just tape it on with some electrical tape and your car will have the tires spinning fasterüòÇüòÇüòÇ Fun hobby and gets me outside for some fresh air and possibly a walk to show off my car.
If you're not willing to put time and money into a car definitely wouldn't recommend. But a fun hobby flipping it over and charging the batteries, but racing and seeing everyone excitement when I take my car to public places and just drifting something around that doesnt cost a big bill is nice. Fun hobby and you meet the rc people around you're neighborhoodüòÅ

title: Perfect For Beginners
text: I bought this as a gift for my husband and he absolutely loves it, in fact he is helping me with this review.  The truck is easy to drive and he actually takes my three and a half year old son with him and he says our son can drive it fine!  As he says it is perfect for someone just getting into RC cars, it's not too fast that you can't control it but it has enough speed to have a blast.  It comes with two batteries and they do last a good while.  What's great is this truck doesn't break the bank, highly recommended!

title: Broke during first use
text: We finally decided to invest in a remote control vehicle that wouldn‚Äôt break immediately‚Ä¶and it broke immediately. Initially, it was a lot of fun, it felt sturdy and it went fast! Unfortunately, by the second use, we already had problems. The first problem was that when it was running at full speed, it would get stuck on. That presented a safety hazard, as you couldn‚Äôt decelerate or stop if it was getting close to people. Usually, it would run into something and I could pick it up and turn it off (while the wheels were still running). After a few times of this, it ran into a cement stair and the back axel broke, so now it is completely broken. It‚Äôs hard to know with so many fake reviews on Amazon what is a quality product, but this is not it.

title: Started Off Great - Lasted 45 days and died
text: I received this as a Christmas gift from my wife (I'm a big kid), and it was great for about 45 days. I used it on the weekends around the house. Never in dirt or wet environments. It abruptly stopped working without any major accident. It was rolling along and just stopped. I turned the receiver and transmitter off. I turned on the receiver, and it would blink blue. Once I turned on the transmitter, the receiver light immediately turned off. I tried a couple more times, and it did the same thing. I charged the batteries, but the same thing happened. I contact Amazon via the chat option, and they said that they would contact the manufacturer and get a resolution. That never happened, and I wasn't contacted by anyone. I went to Laegendary's website to try and contact the seller directly through their website (provided item description, order number, contact info and issues), but I never received a response. At this point, it is a $170 paper weight. I'm hoping that this review provides me a resolution or (if no action is taken by Amazon or Laegendary) persuades others to by a different product. Hoping for the best.

text:
This was the ‚Äúbig‚Äù Christmas gift for my 7 year old son. He was super excited and had no trouble using it. On first day, the wheel fell while he was driving it around the basement despite tightening wheels prior to driving as the instructions advised. We could not find the little pin that held the nut and wheel in place. We had to wait for another nut and pin to arrive, replaced, and were back in business. Battery life and remote was fine but after about a week, the remote and car would no longer pair. Changed batteries, tried some tricks in the instructions but nothing worked. Took to local hobby shop who said they never heard of the brand and they do not carry parts for it.
Unfortunately, it was unusable more than USABLE and We sent it back. The RC car at the hobby shop is a little more expensive, but it works and they can offer help if needed.

title: Great truck, son loves it!
text: I bought this truck for my son for his 8th birthday.  Right out of the box it looks great.  I charged the batteries and drove it around the house to check it out and I was impressed.  When I gave it to him I was amazed at how quickly he picked up driving it and it wasn't long before he was doing wheelies and jumps with it.  Even my brother, who has had at least two Traxxas trucks and is almost never satisfied with anything, liked it.  In fact, I  think he drove it as much as my son did at his birthday party.  I'll be interested to see how it holds up long term but I was impressed by the availability of replacement parts.  I'll probably wind up saving up a little and getting myself one too so we can run them together.  RC cars can be a very expensive addiction and I would definitely recommend this truck for anyone considering getting into it.  It seems tough enough to really enjoy but also cheap enough to turn a kid loose with it without giving yourself a heart attack.

title: Awesome trucks that broke on first day of use
text:
Updated- it appears that I can replace the broken part for a fairly inexpensive price. It still broke prematurely however the overall design seems superior to the competitors. Time will tell if this was a fluke or if it is a design prone to failure.

Let me start by stating that I have several other similar rc trucks from competitor companies. At first this one seemed to be superior in construction and design however the frame broke the first time in use. The biggest problem is that it broke at a place that could not be repaired with replacement parts. None of my other rc trucks have never had a catastrophic failure like this. I've driven thr others for months and only ever had to replace a few of thr regular "replaceable" parts. This was the most expensive rc truck I have and this is extremely disappointing. Unless I can get the company to help me out I am stuck with a $150 parts kit.

title: Car is a rebranded 9125 Xinlehong. Breaks constantly.
text:
This car is a rebranded 9125 Xinlehong RC car. Uses all the exact same part numbers. The parts are very cheap and break easily.

I have had this car for 4 months now and with regular bashing experience can tell you the weaknesses and parts that break a lot. So far I have replaced 4 Front Drive shafts, 3 Rear Transmission Cups, and 3 Differentials.

All of the parts I have ordered online take a very long time to arrive so you usually have to buy them in larger quantities. Additionally, one of the motors tweaked out after being driven through a puddle and required a creative repair which I was able to do. (So far have not had to replace the motors)

Some other issues: the plastic Screw threads will strip out because you are constantly having to work on the car to change things. You can try the CA GLUE trick to try to fix the plastic threads but you could end up getting yourself a stuck screw.

The car broke within 3 days of first usage, (front drive shaft) then within 2 weeks of usage the rear differential went out. 2 weeks later the next differential went out. Following a few minor crashes, the Rear Transmission cups bent and needed replacing. The tire plastic bindings are breaking but can be glued using CA glue to reinforce them. They are still going strong. Following those initial breaks, I continued to have the same breaks over the following months. Probably the most frustrating break is the Differentials just do not last.

I am not that hard of a basher, in fact, I am a decent RC driver and have very few hard crashes. On average, even with basic street driving the average life span of your differential is about 2-4 weeks, while the life span of the Servo is about 2 months. I was able to repair the servo myself without replacing it by manipulating the gears. The gears inside the servo are plastic and break easily.

I also own an Arrma Granite. I spent $210 dollars on the Arrma Granite and for the price I have spent on parts for that car, I can say with confidence that the Legend Rebranded knock off of the rebranded 9125 Xinlehong RC is not worth your money. You will end up spending way more money and time on fixing it then you would if you spent money on an Arrma Granite. Additionally, any Arrma or Traxas product can be fully upgraded and customized. The Legend Truck cannot.

Companies that sell cheap products like this know they will make a huge profit because you will be constantly buying replacement parts. Arrma is a much more trustworthy company that makes RC cars that go the distance. Out of the time I've owned the Granite, I've only had to replace two parts, the motor ($20 bucks) and a spur gear ($4 bucks). For this Legend Truck (rebranded 9125 Xinlehong) I have spent over $100 bucks on replacement parts already.

Do the math, Buy an Arrma Granite for $210 and spend way less money on parts or buy a knock off Xinlehong 9125 and spend $160 bucks plus $100 dollars in parts and repairs over the course of 4 months.

The only reason its rated 2 stars is because apart from it constantly breaking, the car is fun to drive, has great handling, and has some nice zip to it.

title: Great Truck! Powerful, Great Quality for price! Smaller than 1/10!
text:
First off this is a great truck for the price. The truck itself is sturdy has great oil filled shocks and metal skid plates and bogbones. Tires are great and high quality. The battery last longer than I thought it would and the double battery system, although odd, is pretty cool. That leads to it's first down fall. The battery compartment is too small. One battery fit snug in there. Two batteries aren't supposed to fit. The Legend comes with a velcro strap to secure the batteries when you use both at once. With the amount of slack on the wires and the bulky two battery connector it is hard to get the batteries seated properly. However once you find a way that works the strap secures it well enough. Careful though when you use both batteries you have to leave off the lid. This may lead to water getting in there. I would recommend if your driving it in wet conditions to use one battery with the lid secure. With the double batteries you get great playtime!! If it is dry I have no problems using the double batteries. Overall I love the idea and the choice of using one or two! Next I would say the remote works well however feels kinda cheap but has nice functions on the top. Trim,dual rate adjustment(steering) , steering reverse, speed mode(high or low). Once the power is turned on lights illuminate along the top functions as indicators. The steering wheel feels good and with the Dual rate adjustment I was able to set it up at the right sensitivity that felt right. Overall happy with the remote, wish it felt of higher quality, but works well and does the job. Powering on the Legend and giving it a spin instantly you can tell this thing is a beast for the price! Thing has tons of torque! When in high speed you can pop wheelies at any speed with a quick pull of the throttle. I wish this thing came with a wheelie bar installed. I may try to get one for it. The shocks work great when making jumps. It's just a delight to drive around. Has a good hum of the motors and isn't as loud as I thought. Truck looks great however its a bit small for 1/10 scale. When compared to my 1/12 scale car it is taller and wider but shorter. I supplied pictures for reference. Seems like to me they should have it labeled 1/12 but I'm not sure exactly how scales work. Overall I very happy with the looks of the truck. The shock color and dual shocks in the back look great. The body looks great also. Tires look huge and wheels are cool.

So quick over view

This truck is a beast with 4wd and lots of torque. It is fast and powerful. Comes with 2 lipo batteries, 1 usb charger, 1 wall charger, double battery connector and velcro strap to secure when using double batteries. Cool system but in double mode be careful in wet conditions because the lid is left off battery compartment. Remote has great functions and steering wheel but feels a little cheap. Does the job. Looks great but small for 1/10 scale.

Final opinion

I really feel this truck is well worth the money and of high quality. Parts are available on a few websites when needed so it makes me more comfortable with driving it rough. Its a fun, mean truck!

title: Worth the money.
text:
Personally your getting a power package deal. Brushless Motor, 4x4, water proof/resistant.

I would ony run it on 2S. I tried 3S and plastic frame parts will not hold up to abuse unless you Engineer the weak spots and problem solve. I went back to 2S and still get enjoyment and less parts breaking.

Weakest areas ive found so far is the upper arms snap, Rims start to crack after jumping and ramping, Shocks plastic tube will start to bust in half from lands or what not. I have replaced these numerously. I think i might have found the solution. Good quality parts are hard to find for RC's. Metal is your friend and i have not yet found any metal arms for this thing. Hopeing one day there will be metal A-Arms to upgrade to.

So i give 4****'s for this RC. Beings your getting a awesome Power Perfomance right out the box.

Heres the project im building 4x4 Monster Truck with 2 different sets of Clod Tires, Rims & Shocks. Basically i went from model cars to RC Cars now. I just needed a change of enlightment.

4**** Review. Worth buying. Keep it to 2S or youll be repairing alot of plastics.

title: Parts are poorly engineered and constructed
text: I‚Äôve owned 2 of these cars now for 8 months. The differentials keep failing. You will notice this when your car unilaterally turns in either direction upon acceleration. I have replaced all 4 (between 2 cars) numerous times. I‚Äòve emailed the company every time one broke to let them know this part keeps failing and needs to be RE-engineered. They‚Äôre most recent response was they have a new, RE-engineered part coming out in June and in the meantime I should buy yet another replacement part. So they‚Äôre obviously aware of this defective part. I‚Äôve now converted both my cars to 2WD to reduce the maintenance cost of these poorly engineered cars. Laegandary does not stand by its product. Consider this when purchasing your next RC car.

title: Great Purchase!  13 year old son and I are very pleased!
text: [[VIDEOID:3cf4a32ee0871002d0a20314af2f146f]] Our first serious RC car.  It looks great.  Build quality and finish is excellent.  It has a pleasing heavy-weight feel to it, solid tires, wonderful suspension action and the undercarriage is convincing robust after putting it through it's paces on rough terrain.  It's a lot of fun to drive, both on concrete and grass. Steering is not difficult, but we were glad to have the half speed option to get used to controlling.  We had it spinning and bouncing around trees throwing up clouds of dust and acorns.  Quality of USB chargers for two batteries seem good.  We roughly got about 15 minutes charge out of each battery.  Bit fiddly to take the cover off and turn the car on/off, but not a big deal.

title: Fast learning curve and boy this thing is durable!
text:
The car was wicked right out of the gate. I followed the recommendations for break in and as time passed, it got faster and faster. Loads of power and great control and the steering response is tweakable with the the RC controller. I have about 1/4 acre back yard with plenty of obstacles for "training" including rocks, ramps and trees to avoid with a few dusty areas for "burn outs"...awesome!
So I'm not an engineer but my first observation was battery life was "so so" even when coupling the 2 batteries together so I took a chance and bought two 7000mAh Lipo batteries off Amazon which work well. Or at least work until the heat protection circuit of the car kicks in and brings everything to a halt. It's worth getting extra batteries and maybe a second car when the first one overheats. I modified my car by putting some brackets in the mid-body to hold a strap and keep the large heavy battery in place (see above). There is a relatively "safe" area to put in some small screws to hold these brackets and secure a strap. I also bought a bunch of stickers to adorn the body. My kids had fun putting them on!!...hehe.

title: Best features - control over turning radius and 2 speed settings
text:
PROs: My 8 year old and I bought these for fun together. We have taken them to campsite with lots of tress and leaves and open space and to the beach. It exceeds expectations and is a blast. The range of the remote goes further than your vision allows. The 2 speed settings helps with control in the environment. The control over turn radius made a huge difference in controlling 360s and spin outs in sand and leaves. We never ran out of battery and played for an hour or so each time. The batteries are very tightly packed.
CONS: you need pretty big open space to play with them, the batteries and connectors are such a tight fit there is only one way they fit and the connector had to be turned a certian way and slightly forced into place. i liked that it was tightly packed. At the beach we violated one of the rules and drove into an approaching 2-3 inch wave and the water fought the steering and popped the gear so we lost steering. Based on the simplicity of the build for home maintenance, we expect to be able to disassemble and reset. Finally - reverse works very well as a brake but I had a hard time getting the reverse itself to engage. Reverse does require a 2 step stop and reverse trigger movement but I had a hard time with the latter. It always eventually worked but after multiple attempts at times.

title: Awesome starter RC Cars
text:
I bought 2 Laegendary RC cars at first, one for me and one for my youngest daughter (the older one wasnt intersted). Right away, we all found out how much fun it is to race up and down the street in front of our house. The cars are easy to control in Low Speed, and can be almost uncontrollable in High Speed. The fact that the cars have two speeds is a big plus. Shortly after we got the first two cars, my older daughter decided she needed one too and since they are so affordable, I picked up another one. So now we have a fleet of them.

We just started using the dual-battery setup which gives you an hour or more of runtime depending on how you drive. The motors never overheat nor do the batteries. They do get warm but never to the point you cant touch them. The same is true for charging. I charge them in an aluminum pan that is used for heating food so if they did ever decide to overheat, nothing would burn.

We have had some hard crashes and broken parts, but that was not a big deal as the parts are readily available on Amazon and (before the virus outbreak) delivered in a day or two. These cars may be priced like toys, but they are well engineered, easily repairable machines. We have only broken bumpers, headlights, and suspension parts. All were easily fixed. The support from Laegendary has been amazing as well. After every purchase, you get a personalized email from the company and they will respond quickly if you have questions.

I would definitely recommend these cars to anyone wanting to get into RC without spending hundreds or thousands of dollars. They are not as fast as some of the other brands, but unless you have wide open spaces to run them, getting a 50MPH car might be overkill.

text: Bought this for a 7 year olds birthday and made his day. I was worried the controls would be difficult for a 7 year old to pick up but within seconds he had the hang of it. Great beginner car!  Hit the curb hard with it after a couple days and the A arm popped off rather than breaking. Popped it right back in and was up and running in minutes. The batteries last LONGER than advertised.

title: parts readily available, out of the box it handles great!!!
text:
This truck is absolutely amazing for the money. It‚Äôs fast stock out of a box. It‚Äôs durable. It has replacement parts readily available. The battery(s) run time is excellent. The staff/customer service behind this product is kind and super friendly. If you email them they respond quickly and are most helpful. What more could you ask for for the price!?!?! Remote control works 100% perfectly fine, only reason I didn‚Äôt give it a five is due to the fact that I have huge hands and wished the trigger fit my hand better. Also Is made out of slightly cheaper plastic HOWEVER is still sturdy. It‚Äôs a lot better than the $30 to $50 car remotes. Trim works well for both steering and speed. Offers a High and Low mode speed wise. I‚Äôve ran it on x2 3S batteries repeatedly and it still works great!!! I‚Äôve seen some people put 4s-5s on it with an additional mini ESC cooling fan. And OMG DOES IT GET SUPER FAST! Whether your are you racing on the track or jumping it at the skate park. (As long as you don‚Äôt miss treated terribly by jumping as high as you can and letting it just smack the ground) this truck handles awesome and can take it no problem. Having all the oil filled shocks is always a plus. It also comes with some bright lights which is cool for dusk driving and at night time. Basically unless you‚Äôre use to $500-thousand dollar trucks. This thing is probably the best value for the money I‚Äôve found yet in the RC world. Cheers!

PS-after a few runs CVD treaded axle and rear outer transmission cups seem to be easily bendable. Gotta watch out for that. Is definitely a good idea to purchase spare parts (specifically those pieces first when ordering the truck to begin with). Note: they do not offer a better/stronger upgradable solution to this. So if you like race tracks with 1ft or higher jumps included/any kind of bashing whatsoever. Definitely be sure to upgrade suspension and lift it up a little bit, not a bad idea to apply suspension bumpers (to keep truck from bottoming out). And if you bought a truck that came with oil shocks. Be sure to check oil levels out of the box as they often do not come as full as they should be. I switched to a thicker weight oil(50-60wt). Lifted the truck just under a 1/4 of an inch after my first run because of the bent wheel axles (that happened almost immediately). So I just ordered all new dogbones/CVD joints and 108mm oil filled shocks, made shock bumpers out of my old nitro truck fuel line tubing, added cooler (and extra) lighting which is now externally powered off those baby 1/3 sized 18650 type batteries = 7.4v nominal so they weigh basically nothing stay lit for a really really long time between chargers and most importantly leave the drive train power alone. I was able to do all of these upgrades and MOD‚Äôs for under $15.

Replacement bumpers, dogbones, drive cups(wheel hubs/axles) will cost you around $40-$50. I am a avid deal Hunter so I was able to find some of these things much cheaper costing me a total of only $32.

Don‚Äôt let any of this discourage you. This is still one of my favorite trucks I‚Äôve ever got. But like any off-road remote-control vehicle. You‚Äôve got to figure out it‚Äôs weak spots and experiment with what works for you under your specific applications. Also I put some street tires on it for parking lot racing, huge difference. Also found some PVC piping that I was able to cut and fit over top of the stock tires for some extreme drifting that resulted in a ton of fun if you ever wanna switch it up every now and again. Tutorials for that easily found on YouTube.

Enjoy your truck!!!! Drive it respectfully and it‚Äôll perform like a champ.

Also, I wouldn‚Äôt bother with any brushless upgrades. Because at that point you‚Äôll be needing a wheelie bar and a decent amount of work on the steering mechanism. The stock motors and ESC operate great with the batteries that come with it. And As long as the C rating isn‚Äôt too high, 3S Lipo‚Äôs make this thing scream (although it‚Äôs not recommended by the manufacturer and I‚Äôm sure it will obviously caused faster wear and tear). But if you like wrenching. 3s power in these things it pretty awesome as well (gotta be more careful tho).

Update: after talking with customer service about the issues I did have.... I must say I am blown away at the amount of care and time they put into me. They are super honest, very understanding and ridiculously helpful. They definitely helped me out to the point that I‚Äôm going togo buy their other two trucks just because. I love supporting a company like this especially when they support me. Cheers to Their whole team! Thx guys!!!

title: Tough Truck!
text:
1) Car : Excellent quality, sturdy and tough, very easy to figure out which is good because there is minimal instructions. Car handles High grass, low grass, concrete, jumps, drops, and hits wonderfully.
2) Battery: Simple chargers and two LiPo batteries. Comes with a sturdy and well made connector so both batteries can be linked and extend run time. Blew me away with battery life, i'm not used to R/C Cars as much, but with a fresh charge and both batteries, I ran this car hard for almost an hour if not more.
3) Controller/Transmitter: Does what it needs to do, but compared to the car, it is VERY cheap feeling in your hand. However it does work well.

Overall 8/10 would definitely recommend as a starter to see if R/C cars are your thing.

My only complaint is the pins sometimes pop off of body during all the jumps and driving, however we have more pins on the way. Overall great starter hobby RC truck.

title: Worth every penny and more...seriously!!
text:
I have been looking to find a high quality "real deal" RC vehicle for a reasonable price for quite a while. I kept on coming back to Laegendary's RC lineup because the price, promo video, & pictures appeared to show me that this was a quality RC vehicle that I could have some serious fun with. However, since I couldn't touch/feel/kick the tires, had never heard of the brand before, etc it still felt risky. Also, the way the Amazon page sensationalizes the vehicle so much I had a lingering thought that the company might be "all hat and no cattle" just like so many other sellers on Amazon. Ultimately, I thought "what the heck" and took the plunge and ordered it. I am so glad I did because this thing is AWESOME, and Laegendary is spot on with their advertising! I didn't know exactly what to expect, but this toy is a great quality and a TON OF FUN! I have been so impressed that this company does not seem to have cut any corners, which you just don't see often anymore. The materials used to build this car appear to be high quality metals and plastics and appear to be made to last.
In terms of function, this has been incredibly fun to use and is FAST...REALLY FAST! So fast in fact the very first time I pulled the trigger I flipped the truck over, so make sure you have it on the low speed mode until you get used to the crazy acceleration and speed. This truck is all-wheel drive and still burns the tires easily, is surprisingly agile, and can pretty much take on any terrain you throw at it.
There is only one small defect I noticed right out of the box is one of the rear dog-bones is slightly bent, so I will be contacting support to see if a replacement can be sent.
Finally, it was such a cool surprise to see that this company is passionate about charities, as you'll find in an insert that comes with the manual. Way to be an upstanding company!
To sum it up: if you are looking to purchase a great quality RC car, do not hesitate to give this company a try!

title: Good RC truck-fast, powerful and easy to use
text: I did a LOT of research and decided to purchase the 1:10 Legend for my 9 year old son.  He loves it.  I thought it would be too big but it is the perfect size.  The RC is fast, powerful, has solid weight and with the ability to use 2 batteries at once we get more run time.  The (2) 1600mah batteries last a longer than 30 minutes since he doesn't go full throttle all the time.  This truck does go very fast but is really easy to use.  The batteries take 2 hours or more to charge but you get 2 chargers so it's ideal to be able to charge both batteries at once. So far my only complaint is the front and rear bumpers are made of thin plastic and break very easily.  The front bumper broke the first time playing with the truck and the replacement parts are not cheap.  Now my son is afraid to play with it with the bumper broken.  I think if the bumper was made in such a way that they were supported from behind instead of being attached at the bottom that would be a big improvement.  Maybe if they were made of rubber coated metal or hard rubber that would be ideal since this is where the impact happens.  See included image of bumper broken in two places where it attaches to the chassis.  Other than that great RC!  I actually got the 1:16 Sonic brushless model for myself (hey, my kid needs to play with someone, right? lol) but the 1:16 is a little small and it flips over easily.  I wish I had gotten the 1:10 Legend for myself too.

title: Great cars for kids and adults!
text: I bought two for my kids and we love how fast they are.  I like the two speeds so my kids can (mostly) control it in low and I can run it in high.  We‚Äôve run it for over 30 minutes (mostly on low speed) without and problem and never lost power.  We‚Äôve yet to drive it long enough to run the battery out so I don‚Äôt know how long it would last but it has been plenty for my kids. I only have two small complaints.  One is the light wire is barely long enough to plug in and so with the tension on the wire the lights tend to pop out of the bumper. The other is I wish it was possible to turn the car off without removing the pins and the body.  My kids will play with it for 10 minutes and then do something else for 30 minutes and then play with it again and it‚Äôs a pain to keep removing and reinstalling the body (because they can‚Äôt do it on their own). Overall we think they are awesome cars!

title: Excellent quality, really fast, and lots of fun!!
text: After a fair amount of research, I bought the Legend 1:10 based primarily on reviews/cost as a toy to take to the beach.  I was pleasantly surprised by the weight and size of the truck, but was really surprised at the speed!  Even in low gear it's pretty fast, but high gear is almost too fast if you don't have plenty of room to run and turn!  It has front and rear lights that are easy to install. The remote is very easy to use, has accurate steering adjustments and the truck responds very well to the remote commands.  So far I've used it on grass, gravel and concrete but looking forward to the sand.  Also, very glad that it comes with a spare battery (total of two) that are easy to charge/install as well as some spare clips for the cover. title: Powerful and super fun!
text:
This was a gift for 6 year old and he absolutely loves it!
The only thing is battery. As I understand, it is normal for this kind of cars to have 15-20 minutes of play time per battery pack. 1:10 model comes with two batteries, which can be used separately or connected together. It also comes with two chargers: wall outlet and USB. Very nice!
Instructions about battery maintenance are a bit alarming. For example "don't charge over 24 hours", "don't leave battery inside, when not used for long time". Again, I understand the reasoning, but this means adult attention is required.
The car is super powerful! it can climb at 50-60 degrees angle, it goes through mud, sand, gravel, water. It is truly off-road truck. Amazing!
You can also do stunts with it, car is very durable. It can jump, fall, hit obstacles without damage. Keep in mind though. If hit at full speed, this car can cause damage to your pet, child or even adult. Power comes with responsibility.
Oh, and it can drift!

I don't recommend this car for kids under 5. They won't be able to operate responsibly, it's just too fast.

title: Great Car

title: Great product from a great company
text: It's important to note that there are many companies offering similar products to this one, but I was deeply impressed by the customer service and mission statement for Laegendary.  Take a look at their website, contact their customer service, and you'll see what I mean.  When you add the quality and features of this product into the equation, it's a no brainer: this is a fun, well made toy with astonishing performance for the price.  It's definitely a starter RC truck, but as a enthusiast for more years than I care to mention, I'm having a BLAST with this truck.  Again, you'll see similar products from other companies, but none in the price range with these features (oil shocks, 2 batteries ect) and NONE from a company that offers top notch customer service and old fashioned American values (laegendary.com).  Keep this in mind when shopping: these toys do break over time, and you'll need to communicate with someone to get parts and support.  That's not going to happen with most companies selling similar products on Amazon.  By the way, I don't work for this company, I'm just a dad with a 15 year old son who's happy with the purchase and the gift of spending time OFF THE COMPUTER with my kid.

title: Really Fun and Fast
text: The car is fast and easy to control.  I had my child driving it in five minutes of first trying it out, and it was their first R/C car driving experience.  I was surprised by how easy it was to slowly accelerate it you want to and steer.

title: Great Product
text:
Did a lot of research online before I chose this model. I was looking for something to keep entertained that would also be usable on camping trips. I wanted something with reasonable battery life that was 4 wheel drive and good handle pretty rough terrain and reasonable speed. Product durability is a must as I knew I would be pretty rough but not abusive. The legend really delivers. Great handling, able to handle surprisingly rough terrain from deep think grass, to river rock and a marshy grassy area. The headlines and tail lights make if fun to run at dusk as well. The two speed options makes it great to have a "beginner" mode for younger or less experienced drivers.

The battery charge time does take quite a long time but considering I get 30+ minutes or run time depending on the terrain and driving style it's understandable but be prepaired 2+hours for a full batter charge was a little unexpected at fist but with two batteries included that helps break up the wait time. Besides I've never known a battery powered RC car that we didn't wish had a longer battery life and a shorter charge time.

title: This is a little beast!
text: My truck arrived well packaged and complete.  Charged up the batteries, and wow!  This thing is rippin', wheelie popping fast when set on high speed.  Everything worked great right out of the box, had no issues.  The lights look pretty cool, are bright, and you can unplug them if you want.  The controller seems toy grade, but it works well, has steering trim and sensitivity, and also a high/low speed switch.  I highly recommend low speed if you try this out indoors.  I'm an older adult, been into RC for a long time, and I gotta say this is a sweet little truck.  Seems a little small for 1/10th scale, but it is so fast and handles so well I don't care.  Very solid construction, and the suspension works great.  I highly recommend this truck, but for people under 10, I would limit the truck to low speed, it is hella fast on high!

title: Quality reasonable, but NOT as advertised... less than 1:10 scale and speed less than expected
text: I bought a bundle that included 2 trucks and 4 extra batteries for my son and I to get out and to just have some fun. I ran both shortly after unboxing, after installing the included LEDs, and after hooking up the included batteries to give a test. Both trucks seemed responsive to the remotes included and of relatively decent quality, but both seemed very short of hitting the advertised speeds (in high position on the remote). I‚Äôm debating to return due to the smaller size and lack of advertised speed. I'm a bit disappointed and hope that there will be a revision on the scale size/speed capabilities. I would not have purchased, had I have seen an actual size comparison. I had considered purchasing a 2nd bundle, but I think that I'll elsewhere.

title: Good Quality
text: Just opened it and everything is charging up right now. My first thoughts on the product are very good quality. The build feels heavy and made of quality materials. Came with two batteries and two ways of charging them so you can charge them at the same time, which is awesome. Looking forward to driving it as soon as the batteries are all charged up!

title: Great Car
text: I really liked the durability on the car.  I flipped it about four times, working perfectly after the flips. Great car.

title: Hero to zero when given for a gift
text: After using this car for less than 10 hours the front suspension was worn out and needed to be fixed.  Emailed the company and was told they would split the cost of fixing the car with me.  Very disappointing after spending over $160 already on the car.  I ordered parts and repaired the car.  After the using one battery in the car the next day a screw came loose from the rear suspension.  Spent 20 minutes to find that.  Checked and tightened all suspension screws and applied clear nail polish to keep them from loosing again.  Bought 2 of these at the same time.  The other  one lost a wheel after the nut loosened up.  Replaced the nut and but still would come loose.  Same front joint wore out on the second car too.  Now using PB Blaster silicone lube on all suspension joints to not attract dirt and keep the parts from wearing quickly.

title: Better than expected
text: I bought two cars, one for me and one for my 11 year old son. This is the first RC car for both of us and it is much nicer than we expected. The low speed was still a little fast for my son at first but he got the hang of it by the second battery. High speed is so powerful the car sometimes does wheelies at take off and takes a lot of practice to control. High speed is definitely more fun. The car is very good at jumping. The car is very durable. When first learning to drive we ran in to several objects with no major damage to the car. I even had a neighborhood boy ride over the top of the car with both wheels of his bicycle and nothing on the car broke. We are very satisfied with the cars.

title: Durable, Fast, Needs better Battery & possible a controller
text:
For someone whose a beginner it is a very well put together and durable RC.
The quality of the RC Legend 1:10 was much better than I had thought it was going to be. The only issue that I do have with the Legend is that the the response of the control isn't very up to my standards.. When going from full throttle to reverse there is a big delay and for me to get it to reverse it seems like I have to come to a complete stop before it will start reverse. Most RC cars have touchy response and immediately break hard and most will spin the tires in reverse to stop the Rc as soon as possible. Also the battery isn't very long lasting. Definitely not as long as they claim but I was happy to find out that they supplied two batteries in the box.
Beside those two things I recommend this car for even the novice Rc drivers.

title: Very pleased
text: Only had this a couple days, but the quality is excellent for the money, and it is very fast and has lots of power, would definitely recommend this product.

The seven year old has no problem figuring out how to operate everything including changing the battery and using the controller.  Our boys will be entertained for hours and are already talking about building a track, jumps and racing.  This sure beats video games, etc!

title: Not worth what you pay
text:
The batteries do not last as long as advertised (I get around 10 minutes each battery of fully charged), it doesn‚Äôt go as fast as advertised, is not a 1:10 scale. It‚Äôs about 4-8‚Äù short of being a 1:10 scale (depending on which vehicle you measure)
The lights are always on, which is a plus sometimes and can be fun.
Someone I know went to a local hobby store and spent $30 more than this item and they got a MUCH better product. (Larger, faster, better batteries, warranty)

title: The most important Thing to know is This Car isnt completly waterproof
text: It says this car is waterproof but in the guide it clearly says not to let water go pass the bottom of the truck. which I thought was completely waterproof. I guess that's kind'a false advertisement I don't know. And its a great thing they give you to batteries because in rough terrain and beach sand the batteries don't last that long. Other than that I think its a great truck handles and plays well. Tough and durable fast for the price its a great buy very fun. I would recommend this truck and great price for beginners.

title: performance, durability, and battery life
text: We are Newbs to the upper scale RC world.  Bought two of these trucks for two 10 yr olds.  Bought based on the existing reviews.  I'm impressed all around with the quality, durability, and battery life.  Very fun to use.

title: Super fun and Super Fast
text: Love this car. Super fun. Super fast. Dangerously fast even on slow setting. I keep slamming into stuff! I wish I could buy upgrades for the front and rear and a roll cage so that the durability would match the capability of this car. Would buy again.

title: Fun out of the box!
text: The Legend is everything I hoped for. I researched this gift for my son's 8th birthday and wondered if it would be too much, not at all! He picked it up at half speed setting and we had fun for two solid days so far. Very powerful and tuff and always seems to land on its tires and get out of jams. Big score for Dad and I'm having just as much fun!

title: Simply the BEST
text: I have been in RC for along time. I have 2 Nitro Buggies and an electric airplane. ALL way more expensive than this 4wd truck. I got the as an "in between" car, but now its my go to!! its so much fun and reliable and fast. I submerged it in water (by accident) and it kept going. I hit a concrete parking block full blast.... no damage!! I beat the hell out of this for months... every day... no damage. The main gear wore out is what took it out, so of coarse I just bought another!!! and so did my brother. Were both VERY impressed. Like I said in the header Simply the best!! I just wish that you wouldn't advertise so much.... that's the only down side I see because once word really gets out about this truck, its going to cost to much, or they wont be able to keep up with demand. Excellent job!!!!

title: Don't buy legend
